<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CAUTIONARY STATEMENT CONCERNING FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Various statements contained in this Annual Report on Form 10-K, or Annual Report, including those that express a belief, expectation or intention, as well as those that are not statements of historical fact, are forward-looking statements. Our forward-looking statements are generally, but not always, accompanied by words such as &#x201C;estimate,&#x201D; &#x201C;project,&#x201D; &#x201C;predict,&#x201D; &#x201C;believe,&#x201D; &#x201C;expect,&#x201D; &#x201C;anticipate,&#x201D; &#x201C;potential,&#x201D; &#x201C;should,&#x201D; &#x201C;will,&#x201D; &#x201C;may,&#x201D; &#x201C;plan,&#x201D; &#x201C;goal,&#x201D; &#x201C;can,&#x201D; &#x201C;could,&#x201D; &#x201C;continuing,&#x201D; &#x201C;ongoing,&#x201D; &#x201C;intend&#x201D; or other words that convey the uncertainty of future events or outcomes. We have based these forward-looking statements largely on our current expectations and projections about future events and financial trends. While our management considers these expectations and assumptions to be reasonable, they are inherently subject to significant business, economic, competitive, regulatory and other risks, contingencies and uncertainties, most of which are difficult to predict and many of which are beyond our control. There can be no assurance that actual developments will be those anticipated by us. Actual results may differ materially from those expressed or implied in these statements as a result of significant risks and uncertainties, including, but not limited to:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	we have a limited operating history with respect to our near-term principal business, providing push-to-talk (&#x201C;PTT&#x201D;) mobile communication services to targeted small and medium-sized business customers in major market areas

<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our spectrum is a key asset and spectrum values may fluctuate significantly based on supply and demand, as well as technical and regulatory changes; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	government
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	regulation could adversely affect our business and prospects.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	These and other important factors, including those discussed under &#x201C;Business&#x201D; &#x201C;Risk Factors,&#x201D; and &#x201C;Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#x201D; may cause our actual results, performance or achievements to differ materially from any future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by these forward-looking statements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Therefore, you are cautioned not to place undue reliance on such statements.&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PA
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_PARTI">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	RT I.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	IT
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_BUSINESS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EM&nbsp;1.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	BUSINESS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a private wireless communications carrier and provider of mobile workforce communication and location based solutions focused on increasing the productivity of our customers&#x2019; field-based workers and the efficiency of their dispatch and call center operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have commenced launching private push-to-talk (&#x201C;PTT&#x201D;) networks in major markets throughout the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our proprietary and industry-validated suite of mobile communications and workforce management applications improve team communication and field documentation across a wide array of industries, including transportation, distribution, construction, hospitality, waste management and field services.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the same time, we are pursuing broadband spectrum opportunities, including, but not limited to, a Federal Communications Commission (&#x201C;FCC&#x201D;) regulatory process aimed at the realignment of our spectrum to be able to deploy broadband technologies to enterprises.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Private Carrier Dispatch
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are currently deploying and operating dedicated, wide-area, two-way radio networks that offer PTT communications services to primarily dispatch-centric, small and medium-sized businesses.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, we commercially launched our PTT service, which we market as DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, in the greater, Houston, Texas metropolitan area.&nbsp;&nbsp;We commenced service in six additional major metropolitan markets during fiscal 2016, including:&nbsp;&nbsp;Dallas, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Chicago, the greater New York area and Baltimore/Washington.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We offer our DispatchPlus service, which combines pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our proprietary suite of mobile communication and workforce management applications with state-of-the-art digital network architecture and mobile devices supplied by Motorola Solutions, Inc. and its subsidiaries (&#x201C;Motorola&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Developed for dispatch-centric businesses, pdvConnect is an easy to use and efficient mobile communication and workforce management solution that enables businesses to locate and communicate with their field workers and improve the documentation of work events and job status.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also built with the commercial dispatch user in mind, Motorola&#x2019;s digital network architecture allows us to provide highly reliable, instant and wide-area PTT communication services to our customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;We primarily market our DispatchPlus service indirectly through Motorola&#x2019;s dealer network and select other third-party dealers, with sales, marketing and advertising support from our internal sales and marketing team.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Industry Background
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Historically, the dispatch-centric
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	enterprise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	market was primarily served by private networks constructed and operated by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	enterprises for their own use and by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	local Specialized Mobile Radio (&#x201C;SMR&#x201D;) operators. The first SMR operators received authorization from the FCC to offer services on their licensed spectrum in 1980. In 1987, Brian McAuley and Morgan O&#x2019;Brien, our Chairman and Vice Chairman, respectively, founded Nextel Communications
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;Nextel&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to acquire 800 MHz SMR licenses issued by the FCC and to launch what became a nationwide dispatch radio network. Motorola collaborated with them to introduce and deploy the Integrated Digital Enhanced Network (&#x201C;iDEN&#x201D;) technology on which the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Nextel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	digital dispatch radio network was based. After developing the network and growing the total number of subscribers to approximately 23&nbsp;million, Nextel merged with Sprint in August 2005 at a stand-alone value of approximately $36 billion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In June 2013, Sprint de-commissioned the legacy Nextel iDEN network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in favor of deploying
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4G
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	technologies, particularly the global standard LTE.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	At the same time,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sprint attempted to move its iDEN customers over to its deployed 4G network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n addition to Sprint, most of the other large U.S. Tier 1 carriers offer a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	form of PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	service as part of their wireless service offerings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. However, because these carrier PTT services are super-imposed on a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	network designed primarily for telephony and data, many short-comings exist.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Shortcomings can include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	latency (or delay) experienced after the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;button&#x201D; has been pushed due to user unavailability or inactive applications
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decreased quality of service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, impaired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	overall functionality and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reduced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ease of use. While much innovation has been applied, and many downloadable dispatch applications have been developed by third parties, with varying degrees of success,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we believe there are still fundamental
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	issues in the way that one-to-one and one-to-many communications are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	currently
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	handled on telephony and data-based networks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and devices
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The ease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, reliability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and simplicity of the iDEN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	has been lost due to the complications that are inherent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in any attempt to super-impose the desired PTT functionalities on networks and devices
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily designed for alternative uses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our Spectrum Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	September&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we acquired the 900 MHz spectrum Sprint previously utilized to operate the legacy Nextel iDEN network for $100 million, comprising of $90 million in cash and $10 million in shares of our common stock.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We estimate that we acquired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our 900 MHz spectrum for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximately $0.06 per MHz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for each
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the U.S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	population in our licensed market area
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;MHz/POP&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Sprint divested this 900 MHz spectrum primarily because the channel assignments are non-contiguous and not currently useable for the broadband 4G technology it is deploying.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of March&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, Sprint held approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% of our issued and outs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tanding shares of common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The FCC has allocated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum in our portion of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the 900 MHz band into 40, 10-channel blocks of contiguous channels alternating between blocks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	designated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for operation of SMR commercial systems and blocks designated for Business/Industrial/Land Transportation (&#x201C;B/ILT&#x201D;) users, with FCC rules also enabling B/ILT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	licenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to be converted to SMR use. Subsequently, the FCC conducted overlay auctions on the SMR designated blocks that awarded geographic based licenses on a Major Trading Area (&#x201C;MTA&#x201D;) basis while affording operational protection to incumbent, site-based licensees in those areas.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are now the largest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	holder of FCC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	license
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the 900 MHz band,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with a nationwide footprint in the contiguous United States, plus Hawaii, Alaska and Puerto Rico.&nbsp;&nbsp;In this band we hold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, on average, approximately 60% of the total number of SMR and B/ILT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	channels
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the top 20 metropolitan markets in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In this band, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	hold almost every SMR MTA geographic license in all but a few markets in the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as well as certain licenses for B/ILT and converted B/ILT licenses in most major markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we hold on average, 240 of the 400 total 900 MHz channels in the top 20 metropolitan markets in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	There
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are technology choices readily available for our existing spectrum position, across different types of services including narrowband voice dispatch and other data services (i.e. Machine-to-Machine, Internet of Things applications).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our Market Opportunity
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The demand for wireless telecommunications has grown rapidly over the last twenty years, driven by the increased availability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	broadband data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	services,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	new applications,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	technological advancements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in handsets and infrastructure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, regulatory changes, increased competition and lower prices. Within the wireless telecommunications industry, we believe there is a s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	egment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of users who
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a tailored solution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	addressing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the dispatch-centric nature of their businesses. These dispatch-centric
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	businesses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	typically have mobile
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	workforces
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and business operations that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	can be more efficiently managed with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	simple, instant and reliable communications among their employees and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	work groups
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These businesses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	typically
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	operate within industry verticals such as construction, distribution, transportation, field services, waste management and hospitality. Given the nature of their operations, we believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	these businesses can benefit from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	instant PTT communication capabilities, which allow them to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rapidly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	communicate with one touch of a &#x201C;button&#x201D; to another user (one-to-one) or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	many users (one-to-many) within their organizations.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In dispatch environments, PTT offers these businesses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	several advantages over telephony and data-based services, including an easy-to-operate one-touch button, efficiency of communications and rugged equipment optimal for field use. Overall, PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	can provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	businesses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with functionality that increases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	speed, simplicity and reliability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	their
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	communications
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and also facilitates their ability to more effectively manage their mobile workforce and assets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In June 2014, we calculated the potential size of our addressable market for our DispatchPlus services by analyzing 20 major market areas in the United States. Based on that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	analysis, we estimate that there are approximately 6.8&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	potential
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	users
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for our DispatchPlus services
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that are employed by ou
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r target dispatch-centric customers within these markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consisting of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	small and medium-sized businesses of 1,000 or fewer employees in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	transportation, distribution,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	construction,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	hospitality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, waste management, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	field services
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	verticals. This translates to an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	annual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	addressable market size of approximately $2 billion to $5 billion in these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20 major markets, assum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	these customers are willing to pay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$25 to $60 per month
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, per user,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for their wireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	communication
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For our targeted set of dispatch-centric small and medium-sized business customers, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ffer our DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	service, which combines pdvConnect, our proprietary suite of mobile communication and workforce management applications, with Motorola&#x2019;s state-of-the-art digital network architecture and mobile devices.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We designed pdvConnect to help companies increase their productivity through the delivery of real-time information from mobile workers to dispatch operators. The solution enable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	quick
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	communication and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	response among
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	field
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	workers and streamlined dispatch operations through faster exchanges of information by prioritizing messages from the field, which can reduce or eliminate wasteful &#x201C;on hold time
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, pdvConnect allows our business customers to document field incidents and activities and to collect operational data and location based information to improve their operations.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As a cloud-based solution, pdvConnect allow
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	users to deliver voice messages to any computer (via the internet) or to any phone on any network, thereby greatly enhancing the PTT communication capabilities of field
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	workers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and allowing them to communicate not only with personnel within their organizations, but also with suppliers, vendors and customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We bundle
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pdvConnect with the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Motorola
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT handsets and devices
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offer to our customers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, thereby integrating all essential components of the DispatchPlus service.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because pdvConnect is a cloud-based service offering, there is no requirement for our customers to download software to their devices before beginning to use pdvConnect.&nbsp;&nbsp;W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e offer customers ou
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r DispatchPlus service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at a monthly price that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is significantly lower than the price they would pay for comparable services and functionality from the large Tier 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	carriers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Based on our market research, the Tier 1 carriers currently charge their customers monthly fees of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$50 or more per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	user
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for a comparable set of service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	functionality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(i.e., unlimited PTT, mobil
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e resource management solutions,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SMS messages
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offer our DispatchPlus s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ervice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to customers indirectly by entering into sales representative agreements with existing wireless dealers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	selected from Motorola&#x2019;s nation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	wide dealer network

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which we believe consists of over 750 dealers nationwi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de in more than 1,500 locations, and other select third-party wireless dealers.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	support our indirect sales representatives by providing them with training, marketing and advertising support from our internal sales and marketing team.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also evaluating and implementing a number of sales initiatives, including multiple types of lead generation programs and hiring additional sales resources.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe this approach of utilizing existing wireless dealers to serve as our indirect sales representatives, coupled with our direct sales and marketing efforts and initiatives, will enable us to establish a presence in our markets and help to reduce the upfront costs of establishing a nationwide sales and distribution network.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Functionality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2013; We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the workforce enhancement features
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and functionality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	included in our pdvConnect mobile resource management solution, some of which are not offered on local SMR networks, allow our customers to recognize superior value and return on investment.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Capacity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2013; While many
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	local
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	SMR operators have constrained spectrum, the spectrum we acquired from Sprint will generally support significantly more customers per target market.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	pdvConnect.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Historically, we have offered mobile resource management applications, marketed primarily under the name pdvConnect, to customers who utilize Tier 1 cellular networks.&nbsp;&nbsp;pdvConnect is our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	proprietary, cloud-based mobile resource management solution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	dispatch-centric business customers. W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	hen offered as a stand-alone product, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	market pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	thr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ough two Tier 1 carriers in the United States. We previously marketed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	through an international Tier 1 carrier in Mexico
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	until our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	agreement with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	carrier end
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	second
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	quarter of Fiscal 2016. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	entered into standard reseller, co-marketing and license agreements with these third-party
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Tier 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	carriers. Our Tier 1 carrier partners market pdvConnect as an available application to complement their wireless service offerings. Generally, pdvConnect has been offered at a monthly price of up to $19.99
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	per user
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	99.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and 0.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	operating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	from sales of pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	were from domestic and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	international sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, respectively. Revenues from the t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	wo domestic
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	carriers accounted for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	39
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% and 20% of our operating revenues for Fiscal 2016, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Given our focus on offering our DispatchPlus service on our PTT network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believe that sales of pdvConnect through our third-party carriers will continue to decrease as an overall percentage of our operating revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Spectrum Opportuni
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ties
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We are utilizing our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	non-contiguous
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	900 MHz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	spectrum to support
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the deployment of our narrowband PTT business in major markets throughout the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	e anticipate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the demand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for high speed data and video services, even in the case of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our targeted PTT customer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	s,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	provide an impetus for change
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to broadband technologies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	over the longer term.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Accordingly, we are pursuing a regulatory process with the FCC aimed at realigning our spectrum to be able to deploy broadband technologies.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition to this regulatory action, we are also pursuing a number of other spectrum initiatives.&nbsp;&nbsp;We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	past
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	experience and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	successes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of our management team
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, combined with our anticipated market position as a leading private carrier
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	dedicated to businesses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	provide us with the opportunity to increase the value of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	existing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and allow us to pursue additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our Joint Petition for Rulemaking
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In November 2014, we and the Enterprise Wireless Alliance submitted a Joint Petition for Rulemaking to the FCC to propose
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the realignment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of a portion of the 900
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	MHz band from narrowband to broadband.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe this realignment is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s mandate to promote more efficient use of limited spectrum resources generally and its ongoing efforts to make more spectrum available for broadband services specifically, particularly in the spectrum bands below 1 GHz.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In response to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Joint Petition for Rulemaking
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the FCC issued a public notice requesting comments from interested third parties and ask
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ed a number of questions about the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	proposal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. A number of interested third parties, including several incumbent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	licensees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, filed comments with the FCC expressing their views, including both support and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	opposition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and asking a number of technical questions about our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Joint Petition for Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n May 2015, we and the Enterprise Wireless Alliance filed proposed rules with the FCC related to our Joint Petition for Rulemaking
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Comments on the proposed rules were filed in June 2015 and reply comments in July 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The proposed rules outline our recommended procedural and technical operating parameters, including field strength limits, processes related to the administration and sequenc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the proposed realignment of the 900 MHz band
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and requirements for the broadband operators to provide comparable facilities to incumbent licensees, to pay the cost of their realignment and to utilize an emission mask with advanced filtering capability specifically designed to protect licensees adjacent to the proposed broadband portion of the 900 MHz band.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have responded to all requests for information from the FCC and other interested parties, and we are currently awaiting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FCC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	action.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The FCC&#x2019;s action may take a number of forms ranging from: a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking, to a Notice of Inquiry, to a dismissal of the Joint Petition without further action.&nbsp;&nbsp;To our knowledge, the FCC has not reached a decision on our Joint Petition. We currently believe that the most likely outcome is that the FCC will adopt a Notice of Inquiry as the next step in the process.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, at this time we do not know the content or scope of any potential Notice of Inquiry.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry is a vehicle for the FCC to gather additional information for the record.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the FCC elects to adopt a Notice of Inquiry, it could request additional information and input on the optimal use of the 900 MHz band generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry could also request information on the specific issues and proposed solutions raised by us and other commentators during the proceeding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The adoption of a Notice of Inquiry does not mean that the FCC has denied our Joint Petition, or that our Joint Petition will not ultimately result in a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking and, thereafter, the adoption of rules providing for a 900 MHz broadband allocation.&nbsp;&nbsp;We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	continue to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the merits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	proposal and that our Joint Petition is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s past practices and policies.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nevertheless, obtaining a favorable result from the FCC may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	take a significant amount of time
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Moreover
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, there is no assurance that the FCC will adopt our proposed rules, or ultimately approve our Joint Petition. Further, the FCC may impose a number of requirements or restrictions on our business as a condition of its potential approval of our realignment request, which may include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provisions in addition to the procedural and technical parameters and requirements already recommended in our proposed rules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Any such requirements or restrictions may impede or delay our realignment plans, result in our realignment plans being more costly than we currently anticipate or impede our ability to pursue or implement our future broadband initiatives.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Strategic
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Initiatives
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition to pursuing our Joint Petition for Rulemaking, we continue to engage in a number of spectrum initiatives, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Acquiring Spectrum Assets.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	completed a limited number of spectrum acquisitions to support our current and contemplated realignment efforts and the deployment of a future broadband network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	have prioritized, and intend to continue to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	prioritize
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our acquisitions on spectrum licenses, including SMR blocks and site specific licenses, in major metropolitan areas that we believe will ease the process of re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	aligning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a portion of the 900 MHz spectrum from narrowband to broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	assuming
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the FCC approves our Joint Pet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ition for Rulemaking. To date, we have pursued these acquisitions opportunistically and selectively to help avoid unduly driving up the cost of the spectrum licenses we acquire.&nbsp;&nbsp;We intend to continue this opportunistic and selective acquisition strategy, pending further developments in the FCC proceeding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Discussions with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Incumbents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have met, and intend to continue to meet, with a number of incumbent licensees and interested parties in the 900 MHz band, including a number of those who submitted comments to the FCC regarding our Joint Petition for Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our goal with these discussions is to gain a better understanding of the size of the incumbent base and the nature of the systems they are currently operating.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are attempting to build consensus with these incumbents and to resolve any concerns they have expressed regarding our Joint Petition.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&#xFEFF;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Developing a Strategic Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We identified critical infrastructure and enterprise businesses as the initial targeted customers for any future 900 MHz broadband network we deploy.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that building such a dedicated broadband network and providing priority access to the critical infrastructure industry could serve as a natural extension of our existing PTT network and business.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also believe there are opportunities to serve these future broadband customers with current technology solutions to provide an evolutionary path to broadband.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have engaged in market research and have retained outside resources to assist us in developing a strategic plan for this and other potential market opportunities.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also evaluating other potential market opportunities and related potential targeted customer groups that could allow us to leverage our nationwide spectrum position now and in the future.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our efforts to develop such a strategic plan are aimed at maximizing the long-term value of our business opportunities and our spectrum assets.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Technology Evaluation.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our engineering team has also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	evaluated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the technical requirements of any future broadband network in the 900 MHz band and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	specifically,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	whether existing technology can be utilized to support our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	potential future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	network buildout and business plans.&nbsp;&nbsp;These evaluations have helped us to obtain a higher level of confidence that a broadband network can be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	deployed using spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in the 900 MHz band with careful engineering and the use of appropriate filters and other equipment and technology that is commercially available at this time.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Additional Spectrum Opportunities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition to our broadband opportunities in the 900 MHz band, we intend to use the experience and relationships of our executive management team to evaluate and potentially pursue additional spectrum and related wireless service opportunities.&nbsp;&nbsp;One potential opportunity we have been exploring relates to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	First Responder Network Authority (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	FirstNet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, which involves a Congressionally mandated process that provides 20 MHz of spectrum and up to $6.5 billion of funding for the build-out and operation of a prioritized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nationwide Public Safety Broadband Network (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NPSBN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	that also may be used, on a non-priority, excess capacity basis, to meet the wireless service needs of commercial customers.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	s part of our efforts to continue to explore the FirstNet opportunity, we assembled a robust consortium of companies and filed a response to FirstNet&#x2019;s RFP (request for proposal) by the May 31, 2016 deadline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Although we understand that a number of other bidders or bidder groups are competing for the FirstNet opportunity, we determined that continuing to explore this opportunity, via the RFP process, was in our stockholders&#x2019; best interests because of a number of benefits to the company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Independent of the outcome of the RFP process, synergies between the NPSBN and our planned broadband facilities could include the coordination of communications between our respective customer targets, first responders for the NPSBN and critical infrastructure entities for our 900 MHz facilities, and the potential to share network deployment, capital and operating costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we can directly utilize the business, technical and other information developed for the FirstNet proposal in planning and preparing for the broadband facilities we plan to deploy.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, participating with a consortium of leading wireless and technology companies has enabled us to establish valuable relationships with these companies and helped to raise the Company&#x2019;s profile within the wireless industry and the technology community, all of which can benefit our existing spectrum initiatives and lead to further opportunities.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also believe that we have access to skilled and experienced personnel and other resources well suited to pursuing opportunities involving the NPSBN.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The FirstNet RFP process is expected to continue for many months, and now that we have submitted our response to the RFP, our activities will be primarily driven by questions or requests issued to us by FirstNet.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given that this is a competitive government RFP process that is governed by confidentiality restrictions, we do not intend to provide interim updates except to the extent required under applicable securities laws.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Of course, there is no assurance that we will be successful in our pursuit of spectrum opportunities related to FirstNet or any other spectrum opportunities that we identify, or in recognizing the benefits we identified related to our continued exploration of the FirstNet opportunity, or in converting our non-contiguous licensed spectrum holdings to contiguous spectrum allocations suitable for broadband uses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
