</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">

	reduce
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our service offering prices; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	respond
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to particular short-term, market specific situations, such as special introductory pricing or particular new product or service offerings, in a particular market.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	To the extent that we are required to offer more competitive pricing packages, our average monthly revenue per user may decrease, which could adversely affect our results of operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, any future pricing pressure could make it increasingly difficult for us to remain competitive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If we do not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	successfully deploy our PTT networks in our existing and future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	markets, it may not be possible for us to compete effectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In June 2015, we commercially launched our PTT service in our first major market located in the greater, Houston, Texas metropolitan area.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequently, we have commenced service in six additional major metropolitan market areas, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Dallas, Atlanta, Philadelphia,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Chicago, the greater New York area, and Baltimore/Washington.&nbsp;&nbsp;We previously announced that we have slowed our deployment of new markets until we have an opportunity to test and optimize the activities we are implementing to increase customer sales, including additional sales training to our indirect sales representatives, lead generation, and marketing and advertising campaigns.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition to containing a large number of potential customers, we intend to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	deploy our PTT networks in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	select
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	major metropolitan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	markets that are strategically located throughout the United States to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	support our brand and our sales and marketing efforts.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	However, if we are not able to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	deploy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT networks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	quickly enough,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or if we do not achieve satisfactory levels of penetration in our identified targeted customer verticals in our deployed markets,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	competing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	services providers may be able to deploy their services and products
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and capture significant market share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	before we are able to enter particular markets or to achieve sufficient scale and penetration rates in particular markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ould make it impossible for us to enter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or to achieve satisfactory operating results in our existing and future markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. If we are unable to enter into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or to achieve satisfactory operating results after entering, a market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we believe that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our overall ability t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	o compete effectively, and our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	overall
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	profitability and growth will be negatively affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The products and services utilized by us and our suppliers may infringe on intellectual property rights owned by others.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	network equipment and mobile
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	products from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Motorola and other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	suppliers that incorporate or utilize intellectual property which we do not own. From time to time our suppliers have received, and we and our suppliers may receive in the future, assertions and claims from third parties that the products or software utilized by us or our suppliers and service providers infringe on the patents or other intellectual property rights of these third parties. These claims could require us or an infringing supplier or service provider to discontinue certain activities or to discontinue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	using or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	selling the relevant products and services. Even when unsuccessful, these claims can be time-consuming and costly to defend, and divert management resources. If these claims are successful, we could be forced to pay significant damages or stop selling certain products or services or stop using certain trademarks, which could adversely affect our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our business could be negatively impacted by disruptions arising from causes beyond our control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Major equipment failures, catastrophic events, power anomalies or outages, natural disasters, including severe weather, terrorist acts or breaches of network or information technology security that affect wireless networks, including tran
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sport facilities, communications switches, routers, microwave links, cell sites or other equipment or third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party owned local and long-distance networks on which we rely, could have a material adverse effect on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	business and results of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We may be limited in our ability to grow unless we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	can timely and cost effectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	expand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	network capacity and coverage and address increased demands on our business systems and processes as needed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our business model depends on our ability to build and grow our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	customer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	base
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and to increase the usage of our services by our existing and future customers, on a timely and cost effective basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. To successfully increase our customer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	base
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and pursue our business plan, we must
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	timely and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	economically:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	If we are unable to achieve increased network capacity, or there are substantial delays in doing so, we could be required to invest additional capital in our infrastructure to satisfy our network capacity needs and otherwise may not be able to successfully in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	crease our number of customers on a timely basis, or at all.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ur operating performance and ability to retain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	customers may be adversely affected unless we are able to timely and efficiently meet the demands for our services and address any increased demands on our customer service, billing and other back-office functions. If we outsource aspects of our customer care function to third parties, we cannot be sure that this outsourcing will not heighten these risks.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our reputation and business may be harmed and we may be subject to legal claims if there is loss, disclosure or misappropriation of or access to our, or our customers&#x2019;, information or other breaches of our information security.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We make extensive use of online services and centralized data processing, including through third-party service providers. The secure maintenance and transmission of customer information is an important element of our operations. Our information technology and other systems that maintain and transmit customer information, including location or personal information, or those of service providers, may be c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompromised by a malicious third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party penetration of our network security, or that of a third-party service provider, or impacted by unauthorized intentional or inadvertent actions or inactions by our employees, or those of a third-party servi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ce provider. Cyber-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	attacks, which include the use of malware, computer viruses and other means for disruption or unauthorized access, have increased in frequency, scope and potential harm in recent years. While, to date, we have not been subject to cyber
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	attacks or other cyber incidents which, individually or in the aggregate, have been material to our operations or financial condition, the preventive actions we take to reduce the risk of cyber incidents and protect our information technology
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and networks may be insufficient to repel a major cyber attack in the future. As a result, our customers&#x2019; information may be lost, disclosed, accessed, used, corrupted, destroyed or taken without the customers&#x2019; consent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, we and third-party service providers process and maintain our proprietary business information and data related to our business-to-business customers or suppliers. Our information technology and other systems that maintain and transmit this information, or those of service providers, may also be compromised by a malicious third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party penetration of our network security or that of a third-party service provider, or impacted by unauthorized intentional or inadvertent actions or inactions by our employees or those of a third-party service provider. We also purchase equipment from third parties that could contain software defects, malware, or other means by which third parties could access our network or the information stored or transmitted on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our or our suppliers&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	networks or equipment. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may face increased risks of becoming subject to cyber-attacks or other cyber incidents as we expand our business model and activities to include establishing and operating our own dedicated network. As a result, our business information, or subscriber or supplier data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may be lost, disclosed, accessed, used, corrupted, destroyed or taken without consent. Any major compromise of our data or network security, failure to prevent or mitigate the loss of our services or customer information and delays in detecting any such compromise or loss could disrupt our operations, impact our reputation and customers&#x2019; willingness to purchase our service and subject us to additional costs and liabilities, including litigation, which could
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	produce
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and adverse effects on our business and results of operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks Related to Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FCC Rulemaking Request, Our Spectrum Initiatives and Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Use of Spectrum
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Spectrum is a limited resource, and we may not be able to obtain sufficient spectrum to support our spectrum initiatives and our planned business operations and future growth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Spectrum is a limited resource that is regulated in the United States by the FCC. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	900 MHz s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	licenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we purchased from Sprint include geographic SMR licenses and site-specific B/ILT licenses. We believe we now own approximately 6 MHz of spectrum on average in the top 20 metropolitan markets in the United States, although we might not achieve 6 MHz of spectrum in each of the top 20 metropolitan markets. We believe this non-contiguous spectrum is more than sufficient to allow us to operate dedicated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	using proven narrowband technologies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in major markets throughout the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Nevertheless, we will need to acquire additional spectrum to support our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	broadband and the other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we elect to pursue,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and may need to acquire additional spectrum to support our future business plans and growth or our introduction of new products and technologies. We intend to prioritize our future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	acquisition of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional FCC licenses for spectrum, including SMR blocks and site specific licenses that we believe will ease the process of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	realigning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a portion of the 900 MHz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	band f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rom narrowband to broadband if and when the FCC approves our Joint Petition for Rulemaking. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	have and intend to continue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to acquire additional spectrum through negotiated purchases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also may elect to acquire additional spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in government-sponsored auctions of spectrum. We cannot assure you, however, that we will be successful in acquiring the additional spectrum we may need to support our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	realignment efforts, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	future growth, our spectrum initiatives, our future network rollout plans or our future product and technology introductions on commercially reasonable terms, or at all. Any failure to obtain the spectrum required for our current and future business plans will adversely impact our revenues and our future growth potential and may adversely impact our ability to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	realign
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	900 MHz spectrum and pursue our broadband spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Joint Petition for Rulemaking
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	may not be successful, or may take more time or be more costly than anticipated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n November 2014, we and the Enterprise Wireless Alliance submitted a Joint Petition for Rulemaking to the FCC to re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	align
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a portion of the 900 MHz band from narrowband to broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe this realignment is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s mandate to promote more efficient use of limited spectrum resources generally and its ongoing efforts to make more spectrum available for broadband services specifically, particularly in the spectrum bands below 1 GHz.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In response to th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e Joint Petition for Rulemaking,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the FCC issued a public notice requesting comments from interested third parties and asked a number of questions about
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the proposal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. A number of interested third parties, including several incumbent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	licensees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, filed comments with the FCC expressing their views, including both support and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	opposition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and asking a number of technical questions about our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Joint Petition for Rulemaking.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2015, we and the Enterprise Wireless Alliance filed proposed rules with the FCC related to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Joint Petition for Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;Comments on t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he proposed rules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were filed in June 2015 and reply comments in July 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The proposed rules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	outline our recommended procedural and technical operating parameters, in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cluding field strength limits,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	processes related to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the administration and sequencing of the proposed realignment of the 900 MHz band and requirements for the broadband operators to provide comparable facilities to incumbent licensees, to pay the cost of their realignment and to utilize an emission mask with advanced filtering capability specifically designed to protect licensees adjacent to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the proposed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	broadband portion of the 900 MHz band.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have now responded to all outstanding requests for information from the FCC, and we currently are awaiting FCC action on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our Joint Petition for Rulemaking
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FCC&#x2019;s action may take a number of forms:&nbsp;&nbsp;ranging from a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking, to a Notice of Inquiry, to a dismissal of the Joint Petition without further action. To our knowledge, the FCC has not reached a decision on the Joint Petition. We currently believe that the most likely outcome is that the FCC will adopt a Notice of Inquiry as the next step in the process.&nbsp;&nbsp;We, however, do not know the content or scope of a potential Notice of Inquiry.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry is a vehicle for the FCC to gather additional information for the record.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the FCC elects to adopt a Notice of Inquiry, it could request additional information and input on the optimal use of the 900 MHz band generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry could also request information on the specific issues and proposed solutions raised by us and other commentators in the proceeding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The adoption of a Notice of Inquiry does not mean that the FCC has denied our Joint Petition, or that our Joint Petition will not ultimately result in a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	continue to believe in the merits of our proposal, and that our Joint Petition is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s past practices and policies.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nevertheless, obtaining a favorable result from the FCC may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	take a significant amount of time
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and resources.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Even if the FCC does decide to move to a rulemaking proceeding, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FCC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2019;s decision
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may be subject to legal objections from other licensees and users of licensed spectrum in the 900 MHz band not held by us. As a result, there is no assurance that we will ultimately be successful in obtaining the necessary approvals required to re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	align
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a portion of the 900 MHz spectrum from narrowband to broadband. Further, the FCC may impose a number of requirements or restrictions on our business as a condition of its potential approval of our realignment request, which may include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provisions in addition to those procedural and technical parameters and requirements already recommended in our proposed rules.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any such requirements or restrictions may impede or delay our realignment plans, result in our realignment plans being more costly than we currently anticipate or impede our ability to pursue or implement our future broadband initiatives.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Moreover, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	believe we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will be required to make additional spectrum purchases and to reconfigure our non-contiguous spectrum to achieve a contiguous
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3x3 MHz position
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in markets throughout the U.S.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our ability to successfully implement this strategy may take more time and be more expensive than we currently anticipate, and we ultimately may not be able to complete the necessary spectrum acquisitions and reconfiguration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our spectrum initiatives may not be successful, may require us to raise significant additional capital or may require us to materially change our business plans and operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with our Joint Petition for Rulemaking, we are engaged in a number of initiatives to facilitate our ability to deploy a broadband network in the 900 MHz band and enhance the long-term value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum assets, including a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cquiring
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to support our realignment efforts and the deployment of a future broadband network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, attempting to build consensus with incumbents, developing a strategic plan for our future deployment of a broadband network in the 900 MHz band, and evaluating whether existing technologies and equipment can be used to support such a 900 MHz broadband network.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition to our broadband opportunities in the 900 MHz band, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pursu
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and related wireless service opportunities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;The potential opportunities we have been exploring include several surrounding the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	First Responder Network Authority (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FirstNet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which involves government plans and a related process to provide a substantial amount of funding for the build-out and operation of a dedicated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Nationwide Public Safety Broadband Network (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NPSBN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that also may be used, on a non-priority, excess capacity basis, to meet the wireless service needs of a variety of commercial customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no assurance, however, that we will be successful in our pursuit of spectrum opportunities related to FirstNet or any other spectrum opportunities that we identify, in converting our non-contiguous licensed spectrum holdings to contiguous spectrum allocations suitable for broadband uses, or in deploying any broadband mobile wireless communications network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In addition, any spectrum opportunities we pursue may require us to raise significant additional capital or to materially change our business plans and operations.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Government regulation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	or actions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	taken by governmental bodies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	could adversely affect our business prospects, future growth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	results of operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The licensing, construction, operation and sale of wireless telecommunications systems are regulated by the FCC and, depending on the jurisdiction, state and local regulatory agencies. In particular, the FCC imposes significant regulation on licensees of wireless spectrum with respect to how
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pectrum is used by licensees, the nature of the services that licensees may offer and how the services may be offered,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	resolution of issues of interference between spectrum bands. If we fail to comply with applicable FCC regulations, we may be subject to sanctions, which may have a material adverse effect on our business.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In addition, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he FCC grants wireless licenses for terms of generally ten years that are subject to renewal and revocation. There is no guarantee that our licenses will be renewed. Failure to comply with FCC requirements applicable to a given license could result in revocation or non-renewal of the license, depending on the nature and severity of the non-compliance.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Future changes in regulation or legislation could impose significant additional costs on us either in the form of direct out of pocket costs or additional compliance obligations.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	be subject to FCC regulations that impose obligations on wireless providers, such as federal Universal Service Fund obligations, which require communications providers to contribute to a fund that supports subsidized communications services to underserved areas and users; rules governing billing, subscriber privacy and customer proprietary network information;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rules prescribing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	roaming
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	obligations; rules that require wireless service providers to configure their networks to facilitate electronic surveillance by law enforcement officials; rules governing spam, telemarketing and truth-in-billing; and rules requiring us to offer equipment and services that are accessible to and usable by persons with disabilities, among others.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, some state and local jurisdictions have adopted legislation that could affect our costs and operations in those areas
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including certain billing practices and consumer-related issues that may not be pre-empted by federal law.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Further, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he FCC and other federal, state and local
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	governmental authorities could adopt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	new
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	regulations or take actions, including imposing taxes or fees on our business or that we must pass
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through to our customers, that c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ould adversely affect our business prospects or results of operations.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For example, some jurisdictions have adopted laws restricting or prohibiting the use of portable communications devices while driving motor vehicles, often including PTT devices. If similar laws are enacted in other jurisdictions, we may experience reduced subscriber usage and demand for our services, which could have a material adverse effect on our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Further, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he FCC and Congress may make additional spectrum available for communications services,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which may result in the introduction of additional competitive entrants to the already crowded wireless communications marketplace
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in which we compete
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;For example, the federal government recently created and funded the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	First Responder Network Authority (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FirstNet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which the federal government authorized to help accomplish, fund and oversee the deployment of a dedicated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Nationwide Public Safety Broadband Network (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NPSBN
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such an NPSBN may provide an additional source of competition to the 900 MHz broadband network we intend to deploy if the FCC approves our Joint Petition for Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;Please see the risk factor &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our Joint Petition for Rulemaking may not be successful, or may take more time or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	be more costly than anticipated&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	above regarding the impact government regulations and actions may have on our request
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ealign
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a portion of the 900 MHz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	band
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from narrowband to broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our spectrum is a key asset, and the value of our spectrum may fluctuate significantly based on supply and demand, as well as technical and regulatory changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The FCC spectrum licenses we hold are a key asset of the Company.&nbsp; The value of our spectrum may fluctuate based on various factors, including, among others: the regulatory status of our Joint Petition for Rulemaking; potential uses of our spectrum based on FCC rules and regulations and available technology; the market availability of spectrum; existing demand for spectrum resources; regulatory changes by the FCC to make additional spectrum available or to promote&nbsp;more flexible uses of existing spectrum; the fluctuation of auction prices of spectrum in neighboring bands or any unsuccessful auctions of such spectrum.&nbsp; Similarly, the price of any additional spectrum we desire to purchase to support our spectrum initiatives or our future business plans and growth will also fluctuate based on similar factors.&nbsp; Any decline in the value of our spectrum or increases in the costs of spectrum we decide to acquire could have an adverse e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ffect on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	value and our business and operating results.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks Related to Our Organization and Structure
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We depend on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	executive officers and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	key personnel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our success depends to a significant degree upon the contributions of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our executive officers and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel. Although we have adopted a severance plan for our executive officers, we do not otherwise have long-term employment agreements with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	any of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executive officers or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n addition, there is no guarantee that these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	individuals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will remain employed with us. If any of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executive officers or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel were to cease employment with us, our operating results could suffer. Further, the process of attracting and retaining suitable replacements for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our executive officers and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel whose services we may lose would result in transition costs and would divert the attention of other members of our senior management
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	team
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from our existing operations. The loss of services from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our executive officers or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel or a limitation in their availability could materially and adversely impact our business, prospects and results of operations. Further, such a loss could be negatively perceived in the capital markets. We have not obtained and do not expect to obtain key man life insurance that would provide us with proceeds in the event of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	death or disability of any of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executive officers or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	key personnel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	21

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We may change our operational policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	, spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and business and growth strategies without stockholder consent, which may subject us to different and more significant risks in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executive management team, with oversight from our board of directors, establishes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our operational policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and business and growth strategies. Our board of directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and executive management team
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may make changes to, or approve transactions that deviate from,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our current
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	policies,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and strategies without a vote of, or notice to, our stockholders. This could result in us conducting operational matters, making investments or pursuing different
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initiatives,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	business or growth strategies than those we are currently pursuing. Under any of these circumstances, we may expose ourselves to different and more significant risks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and increase our expenses and financial requirements, any of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which could have a material adverse effect on our business, prospects, liquidity, financial condition and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If we fail to implement and maintain an effective system of internal controls, we may not be able to accurately determine our financial results or prevent fraud. As a result, our stockholders could lose confidence in our financial results, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ould materially and adversely affect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	our value and our ability to raise any required capital in the future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Effective internal controls are necessary for us to provide reliable financial reports and effectively prevent fraud. We have discovered and may in the future discover areas of our internal controls that need improvement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or additional documentation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or example, in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our management identified an error in our calculation and reporting of the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding, and the related net loss per common share (basic and diluted), for the six month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2013 and 2014, the three and nine month periods ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and the nine month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, as reported in our filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Specifically, in calculating the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding, management incorrectly considered the effect of two corporate actions the Company completed in connection with its June 2014 private placement, including: (i)&nbsp;the conversion of all outstanding shares of preferred stock into common stock and (ii)&nbsp;the exchange of nearly all outstanding warrants to purchase preferred stock for shares of common stock (the &#x201C;Corporate Actions&#x201D;), as if such events occurred at the beginning of each of these reporting periods, instead of only considering the effect of these Corporate Actions after their
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	actual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	effective date in June 2014. As a result, our disclosure of the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding for the six month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2013 and 2014, the three and nine month periods ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and the nine month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were higher, and our disclosure of the related net loss per common share (basic and diluted) were lower, than they should have been if we correctly gave effect to the Corporate Actions only after their
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	actual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	effective date in June 2014. Although the corrections ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	no impact on the Company&#x2019;s net loss reported in the statements of operations, balance sheets or the statements of cash flows for the above mentioned periods and our audit committee did not determine that our financial statements for such periods should no longer be relied upon as a result of the errors in the presentation of the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding, our management identified a significant deficiency in our internal control over financial reporting. To remediate the significant deficiency in our internal control over financial reporting, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	implemented additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	internal control procedures, including additional training and review procedures, to ensure we appropriately track, calculate and report the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding, and related net loss per common share (basic and diluted), in future reporting periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Prior to becoming a public company in February 2015, we had not been subject to public reporting requirements and had not been required to assess our internal controls.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In addition, we previously had operated with a limited internal accounting team.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the process of preparing to become a public company, we strengthened our internal accounting team and resources and our internal controls.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nevertheless, w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e cannot be certain that we will be successful in implementing or maintaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	internal control
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s for all
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	periods
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;As
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we grow our business, our internal controls will become more complex, and we will require significantly more resources to ensure our internal controls remain effective.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he existence of any material weakness or significant deficiency in the future may require management to devote significant time and incur significant expense to remediate any such material weaknesses or significant deficiencies and management may not be able to remediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	any such material weaknesses or significant deficiencies in a timely manner.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he existence of any material weakness in our internal control
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	could also result in errors in our financial statements that could require us to restate our financial statements, cause us to fail to meet our reporting obligations and cause stockholders to lose confidence in our reported financial information, all of which could materially and adversely affect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our value and our ability to raise any required capital in the future.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Changes in accounting rules, assumptions and/or judgments could materially and adversely affect us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounting rules and interpretations for certain aspects of our operations are highly complex and involve significant assumptions and judgment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Our reported financial statements have been and will continue to be based on our assumptions and judgments, and any changes in these assumptions or judgments could have a material impact on our results of operations and the other information contained in our financial statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	complexities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of these assumptions and judgments could also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lead to a delay in the preparation and dissemination of our financial statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or could subject our financial statements to restatement if our independent auditors, the SEC or we determine such assumptions or judgments must be changed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Furthermore, changes in accounting rules and interpretations could significantly impact our financial statements. In some cases, we could be required to apply a new or revised standard retroactively, resulting in restating prior period financial statements. Any of these circumstances could have a material adverse effect on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reported
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	condition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We have a concentration of risk related to the accounts receivable from two of our third-party carriers and failure to fully collect outstanding balances from these carriers may adversely affect our results of operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	in the near term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as a mobile workforce management application
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	directly through our sales force and indirectly through third-part
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	y carriers. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we have accounts receivable balances owed to us by two of our carriers representing approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	32
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, respectively, of our accounts receivable balances. We maintain an allowance for doubtful accounts based on the credit risk, historical trends, and other information, as well as for any specific instances we become aware of that may preclude us from reasonably assuring collection on outstanding balances. Determining the allowance for doubtful accounts is judgmental in nature and often involves the use of significant estimates. A determination that requires a change in our estimates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the accounts receivable from either of these two carriers, or a failure by these carriers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to pay a significant portion of outstanding accounts receivable balances, could have a negative impact on our results of operations and financial condition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the near term as we are in the early stages of pursuing our DispatchPlus business
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks Related to Our Common Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We have a limited trading history and there is no assurance that a robust market in our common stock will develop or be sustained.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our common stock began trading on The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tal Market in February 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Since our common stock began trading, we have had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	limited
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	daily trading vo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lume and we cannot assure you that a more active or liquid trading market for our common stock will develop
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	be sustained if it does develop either of which could materially and adversely affect the market price of our common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our ability to raise capital in the future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the ability of stockholders to sell their shares at the volume, prices and times desired. In addition, our lack of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	significant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	operating history relevant to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	business
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the early stage of development of our spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	makes it difficult to evaluate our business, our future prospects and the valuation of our Company, which limits the liquidity and volume of our common stock, and may have a material adverse effect on the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our common stock prices may be volatile which could cause the value of our common stock to decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Prior to the listing of our shares of common stock on The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capital Market in February 2015, there was no public market for our common stock. The market price of our common stock may be highly volatile and subject to wide fluctuations. Our financial perfor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mance,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, tax laws, interest rates and market conditions in general could have a significant impact on the future market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Some of the factors that could negatively affect or result in fluctuations in the market price of our common stock include:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">

	&#xB7;

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the rate of customer adoption of our DispatchPlus service, the rate of our deployment of our PTT networks or
</FONT>

	actual or
</FONT>

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	actions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	stockholders;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
