<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Concentration of ownership will limit your ability to influence corporate matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on our review of publicly available filings a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	May 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	funds affiliated with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cerberus Capital Management
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	beneficially owned approximately 24.5% of our outstanding shares of common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, our next five largest stockholders beneficially owned an aggregate of approximately 42.9% of our outstanding shares of common stock based on publicly available filings a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	May 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(including, 12.7% by funds affiliated with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Owl Creek; 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	% by funds affiliated with Pacific Investment Company; 7.8% by funds affiliated with American Financial Group; 6.0% by funds affiliated with QVT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Financial LP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	; and 5.8% by funds affiliated with Credit Suisse). In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	our directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	executive officers beneficially owned appro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ximately 9.51%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	our outstanding capital stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Although we are not aware of any voting arrangements between these stockholders,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	y have the ability to determine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	if acting together
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) or significantly influence (if acting as a group of two or more): (i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the outcome of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	corporate actions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	submitted by our Board of Directors for approval by our stockholders and (ii) any proposals or director nominees submitted by a stockholder
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Further, they could place significant pressure on our Board of Directors to pursue corporate actions, director candidates and business opportunities or initiatives they identify.&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, these stockholders could effectively block the proposed sale of the company recommended by our Board of Directors.&nbsp;&nbsp;Alternatively, these stockholders could place pressure on our Board of Directors to pursue a sale of the company or its assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	concentration&nbsp;of&nbsp;ownership
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	our other stockholders
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	may have no effective voice in our corporate actions or the operations of our business, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	may adversely affect the market price of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company,&#x201D; and the reduced disclosure requirements applicable to emerging growth companies may make our common stock less attractive to investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company,&#x201D; as defined in the JOBS Act, and may remain an emerging growth company for up to five years. For so long as we remain an emerging growth company, we are permitted and intend to rely on exemptions from certain disclosure requirements that are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies. These exemptions include:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Not being required to comply with the auditor attestation requirements in the assessment of our internal control over financial reporting;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Reduced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	disclosure obligations regarding executive compensation; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Exemptions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	from the requirements of holding a nonbinding advisory vote on executive compensation and stockholder approval of any golden parachute payments not previously approved.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We cannot predict whether investors will find our common stock less attractive if we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	continue to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	rely on these exemptions. If some investors find our common stock less attractive as a result, there may be a less active trading market for our common stock and our stock price may be more volatile.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition, the JOBS Act also provides that an emerging growth company can take advantage of an extended transition period for complying with new or revised accounting standards. This allows an emerging growth company to delay the adoption of certain accounting standards until those standards would otherwise apply to private companies. Nevertheless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	at this time, we have elected not to avail ourselves of this extended transition period and, as a result, we will adopt new or revised accounting standards on the relevant dates on which adoption of such standards is required for other public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	We do not intend to pay dividends on our common stock for the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We currently intend to retain our future earnings, if any, to finance the development and expansion of our business
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and pursuit of our strategic initiatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and, therefore, do not intend to pay cash dividends on our common stock for the foreseeable future. Any future determination to pay dividends will be at the discretion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	irectors and will depend on our financial condition, results of operations, capital requirements, restrictions contained in any financing instruments and such other factors as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	irectors deems relevant in its discretion. Accordingly, you may need to sell your shares of our common stock to realize a return on your investment, and you may not be able to sell your shares at or above the price you paid for them.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Future sales of our common stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	or preferred stock, or of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	other securities convertible into our common stock or preferred stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	could cause the market value of our common stock to decline and could result in dilution of your shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	irectors is authorized, without stockholder approval, to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	permit us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to issue additional shares of common stock or to raise capital through the creation and issuance of preferred stock, other debt securities convertible into common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or preferred stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	options, warrants and other rights, on terms and for consideration as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	irectors in its sole discretion may determine. Sales of substantial amounts of our common stock or of preferred stock could cause the market price of our common stock to decrease significantly. We cannot predict the effect, if any, of future sales of our common stock, or the availability of our common stock for future sales, on the value of our common stock. Sales of substantial amounts of our common stock by Sprint or Motorola or another large stockholder, or the perception that such sales could occur, may adversely affect the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with becoming a public company, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	filed a registration statement on Form S-8 to register the total number of shares of our common stock that may be issued under our 2004 Stock Plan, 2010 Stock Plan and 2014 Stock Plan, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the equity awards issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to our e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	xecutive officers and directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Additionally, in January 2016, we filed a registration statement on Form S-8 to register
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	714,583
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional shares of common stock made available under the 2014 Stock Plan&#x2019;s evergreen provisions, which provide for an annual increase on January 1 under the 2014 Stock Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	by an amount equal to the smaller of&nbsp;5%&nbsp;of the number of shares of common stock issued and outstanding on the immediately preceding December&nbsp;31 or a lesser amount determined by the Board.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	These shares of common stock are eligible for sale without restriction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of May&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our directors and executive officers beneficially owned an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	9.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	51
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	% of the equity interests in our Company, including restricted stock units and stock options. Subject to vesting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and to transfer restrictions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	set forth in our insider trading policy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our directors and executive officers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	immediately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sell
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	their shares of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	common stock into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the public
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, we may also issue additional shares of our capital stock or other securities that are convertible into or exercisable for our capital stock in connection with hiring or retaining employees or for other business purposes, including future sales of our securities for capital raising purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;The future issuance of any such additional shares of capital stock will result in the dilution of the ownership interests of our present stockholders and may create downward pressure on the trading price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Future offerings of debt securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	or preferred stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	, which would rank senior to our common stock upon our bankruptcy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	liquidation, may adversely affect the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the future, we may attempt to increase our capital resources by making offerings of debt securities or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	otherwise incurring debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Upon bankruptcy or liquidation, holders of our debt securities and lenders with respect to other borrowings will receive a distribution of our available assets prior to the holders of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	preferred stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that provides holders with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a preference on liquidating distributions or a preference on dividend payments or both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that could
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	otherwise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	limit our ability to pay dividends or make liquidating distributions to the holders of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Although we have no present plans to do so, o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ur decision to issue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or to issue preferred stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in any future offering
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s or otherwise incur debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	depend on market conditions and other factors beyond our control. As a result, we cannot predict or estimate the amount, timing or nature of our future offerings, and investors in our common stock bear the risk of our future offerings reducing the market price of our common stock and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	diluting their ownership interest in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We incur increased costs as a result of being a public company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As a public company with securities registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#x201C;Securities Act&#x201D;), we need to comply with certain laws, regulations and requirements, certain corporate governance provisions of The Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (&#x201C;The&nbsp;Sarbanes-Oxley Act&#x201D;), related regulations of the SEC, and the requirements of The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capital Market. Complying with these statutes, regulations and requirements will occupy a significant amount of time from our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	oard of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	irectors and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	executive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	management
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	team,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and will significantly increase our costs and expenses going forward.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are subject to Section&nbsp;404 of The Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, or Section&nbsp;404, and the related rules of the S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	EC,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which generally require our management and independent registered public accounting firm to report on the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. Beginning with th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is Form 10-K, which is the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	second annual report that we will be required to file with the S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	EC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, Section&nbsp;404 requires an annual assessment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. However, for so long as we remain an emerging growth company as defined in the JOBS Act, we intend to take advantage of certain exemptions from various reporting requirements that are applicable to public companies that are not emerging growth companies, including, but not limited to, not being required to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section&nbsp;404. Once we are no longer an emerging growth company or, if prior to such date, we opt to no longer take advantage of the applicable exemption, we will be required to include an opinion from our independent registered public accounting firm on the effectiveness of our internal controls over financial reporting. We will remain an emerging growth company until the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year following January&nbsp;26, 2020, (b)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year in which we have total annual gross revenue of at least $1.0 billion,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(c) the date on which we are deemed to be a large accelerated filer, which means the market value of our common stock that is held by non-affiliates exceeds $700 million as of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	end of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	prior
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	second fiscal quarter (currently
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	September&nbsp;30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or&nbsp;the date on which we have issued more than $1.0 billion in non-convertible debt during the prior three-year period.
</FONT>
</P>

	Certain anti-takeover defenses and applicable law may limit the ability of a third party to acquire control of us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Certain provisions of our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws could discourage, delay, or prevent a merger, acquisition or other change of control that stockholders may consider favorable, including transactions in which you might otherwise receive a premium for your shares. These provisions also could limit the price that investors might be willing to pay in the future for our common stock, thereby depressing the market price of our common stock. These provisions, among other things:

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition, w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	e have elected to be subject to Section&nbsp;203 of the Delaware General Corporation Law (the &#x201C;DGCL&#x201D;) by provision of our charter.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In general, Section&nbsp;203 of the DGCL prevents an &#x201C;interested stockholder&#x201D; (as defined in the DGCL) from engaging in a &#x201C;business combination&#x201D; (as defined in the DGCL) with us for three years following the date that person becomes an interested stockholder unless one or more of the following occurs:
</FONT>
</P>

	Upon consummation of the transaction that resulted in the interested stockholder becoming an interested stockholder, the interested stockholder owned at least 85% of our voting stock outstanding at the time the transaction commenced, excluding for purposes of determining the voting stock outstanding (but not the outstanding voting stock owned by the interested stockholder) stock held by directors who are also officers of our Company and by employee stock plans that do not provide employees with the right to determine confidentially whether shares held under the plan will be tendered in a tender or exchange offer; or
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Following the transaction in which that person became an interested stockholder, the business combination is approved by our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board of D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	irectors and authorized at a meeting of stockholders by the affirmative vote of the holders of at least 66
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:4PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&nbsp;2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% of our outstanding voting stock not owned by the interested stockholder.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The DGCL generally defines &#x201C;interested stockholder&#x201D; as any person who, together with affiliates and associates, is the owner of 15% or more of our outstanding voting stock or is our affiliate or associate and was the owner of 15% or more of our outstanding voting stock at any time within the three-year period immediately be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	fore the date of determination.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, our election to be subject to Section 203 of the DGCL could limit the ability of a third party to acquire control of us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Claims for indemnification by our directors and officers may reduce our available funds to satisfy successful third-party claims against us and may reduce the amount of money available to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws provide that we will indemnify our directors and officers, in each case to the fullest extent permitted by Delaware law. In addition, as permitted by Section&nbsp;145 of the Delaware General Corporation Law, our amended and restated bylaws and our indemnification agreements that we have entered into with our directors and officers provide that:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We will indemnify our directors and officers for serving us in those capacities or for serving other business enterprises at our request, to the fullest extent permitted by Delaware law. Delaware law provides that a corporation may indemnify such person if such person acted in good faith and in a manner such person
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reasonably believed to be in or not opposed to the best interests of the registrant and, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	respect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to any criminal proceeding, had no reasonable cause to believe such person&#x2019;s conduct was unlawful.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">

</FONT>

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MARKET FOR REGISTRANT&#x2019;S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Market Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On February&nbsp;3, 2015, shares of our common stock became listed for trading on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Capital Market under the symbol &#x201C;PDVW.&#x201D; Prior to the listing of our shares of common stock on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Capital Market, there was no public market for our common stock. The following table sets forth the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	high and low sales prices of our common stock as reported by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Capital
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Market for the periods indicated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	e&nbsp;

	2015, we had

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	252

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	record holders of our common stock.

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	The number of beneficial owners is substantially greater than the number of record holders because a large portion of our common stock is held of record through brokerage firms in &#x201C;street name.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Dividend Policy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have never declared or paid any cash dividends on our common stock, and we do not currently anticipate declaring or paying cash dividends on our common stock in the foreseeable future. We currently intend to retain our future earnings, if any, to finance the development and expansion of our business. Any future determination to pay dividends will be at the discretion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and will depend on our financial condition, results of operations, capital requirements, restrictions contained in any financing instruments and such other factors as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	deems relevant in its sole discretion. See &#x201C;Risk Factors &#x2013; Risks Related to our Common Stock&nbsp;&#x2013;We do not intend to pay dividends on our common stock for the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	The following performance graph and related information shall not be deemed &#x201C;soliciting material&#x201D; or to be &#x201C;filed&#x201D; with the SEC, nor shall such information be incorporated by reference into any future filing under the Securities Act or the Exchange Act, except to the extent that we specifically incorporate it by reference into such filing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The performance graph set forth below compares our cumulative total stockholder return since we commenced trading on February&nbsp;3, 2015 through March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, assuming an initial investment of $100 in our common stock, and in each of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Capital Market Composite Index and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Telecommunications Index, and assumes the reinvestment of dividends. No dividends have been declared or paid on our common stock. The comparisons in the performance graph below are required by the SEC and are not intended to forecast or be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	indicative of possible future performance of our common stock, and we do not make or endorse any predictions as to future stockholder returns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_5"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Securities Authorized for Issuance Under Equity Compensation Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company awards stock options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and restricted stock units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to its employees meeting certain eligibility requirements under plans approved by its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	holders in 2004, 2010 and 2014, referred to as the &#x201C;2004 stock option plan&#x201D;, &#x201C;2010 stock option plan,&#x201D; and &#x201C;2014 stock option plan&#x201D;, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">

	&#xFEFF;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On May 18, 2015, we completed a public offering of our common stock in which we raised net proceeds of approximately $64.8 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;We registered the shares of common stock issued in the offering on a Registration Statement on Form S-1 (File No. 333-203681), which the SEC declared effective on May 12, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Through March 31, 2016, we have used approxima
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	tely $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million of the net proceeds from this offering.&nbsp;&nbsp;We did not complete any transaction in which we paid any of these proceeds, directly or indirectly, to our directors or officers, to any person owning 10% or more of any class of our equity securities, to any associate of any of the foregoing, or to any of our affiliates.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#231F20;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	There has been no material change in the expected uses of the net proceeds from the offering as described in our Registration Statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We did not repurchase any equity securities during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ended March&nbsp;31, 201

	6

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.50%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	214,205,954&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.42%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.42%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ITE
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_MDA">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	M&nbsp;7. MANAGEMENT&#x2019;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	The following management&#x2019;s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations should be read in conjunction
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	with our historical consolidated financial statements and the related notes. This management&#x2019;s discussion and analysis contains
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties, such as statements of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	plans, objectives, expectations, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	nd
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	ntentions. Any statements that are not statements of historical fact are forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause our actual results or events to differ materially from those expressed or implied
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	by the forward-looking statement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	. Factors that could cause or contribute to such differences include, but are not limited to, those
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	dentified below and those discussed in the section entitled &#x201C;Risk Factors&#x201D; included elsewhere in this Annual Report. Except as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	required by applicable law we do not undertake any obligation to update forward-looking statements to reflect events or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	circumstances occurring after the date of this Annual Report.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	The management&#x2019;s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations is based on our consolidated financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	statements, which we have prepared in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	(&#x201C;US GAAP&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	. The preparation of these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	financial statements requires us to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements, as well as the reported revenues and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	expenses during the reporting periods. On an ongoing basis, we evaluate such estimates and judgments, including those described in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	greater detail below. We base our estimates on historical experience and on various other factors that we believe are reasonable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying value of assets and liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	that are not readily apparent from other sources. Our actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a private wireless communications carrier and provider of mobile workforce communication and location based solutions focused on increasing the productivity of our customers&#x2019; field-based workers and the efficiency of their dispatch and call center operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have commenced launching push-to-talk (&#x201C;PTT&#x201D;) networks in major markets throughout the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our proprietary and industry-validated suite of mobile communications and workforce management applications improve team communication and field documentation across a wide array of industries, including transportation, distribution, construction, hospitality, waste management and field services.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the same time, we are pursuing a number of spectrum opportunities and initiatives, including but not limited to, a FCC regulatory process aimed at the realignment of our spectrum to be able to deploy broadband technologies to enterprises.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We maintain offices in Woodland Park, New Jersey, Reston, Virginia and San Diego, California.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;We also maintain a sales office in West Conshohocken, Pennsylvania.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We are currently deploying and operating dedicated, wide-area, two-way radio networks that offer PTT communications services to primarily dispatch-centric, small and medium-sized businesses.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, we commercially launched our PTT service, which we market as DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, in the greater, Houston, Texas metropolitan area.&nbsp;&nbsp;We commenced service in six additional major metropolitan markets during fiscal 2016, including:&nbsp;&nbsp;Dallas, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Chicago, the greater New York area and Baltimore/Washington.&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently, we are in the process of completing two additional tower sites that we had initially designed for two of these markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once those are in service, we will have completed the tower sites designed for the initial launch of these markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, in a number of markets, we have or are in the process of deploying additional sites to expand our coverage area in these markets based on specific customer opportunities and/or our assessment of market opportunities.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We offer our DispatchPlus communications solutions, which combines pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, our proprietary suite of mobile communication and workforce management applications with state-of-the-art digital network architecture and mobile devices manufactured by Motorola Solutions, Inc. and its subsidiaries (&#x201C;Motorola&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Built with the commercial dispatch user in mind, Motorola&#x2019;s digital network architecture allows us to provide highly reliable, instant and wide-area PTT communication solutions to our customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also developed for dispatch-centric businesses, pdvConnect is an easy to use and efficient mobile communication and workforce management solution that enable businesses to locate and communicate with their field workers and improve the documentation of work events and job status.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We expect that our DispatchPlus business will become our principal near term operating business.&nbsp;&nbsp;We primarily market our DispatchPlus service to customers indirectly through third-party dealers selected from Motorola&#x2019;s nationwide dealer network and other select wireless dealers.&nbsp;&nbsp;We support our indirect sales representatives by providing them with training, marketing and advertising support from our internal sales and marketing team.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also implementing a number of sales initiatives, including lead generation programs and hiring additional sales resources.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe this approach of utilizing existing wireless dealers to serve as our indirect sales representatives, coupled with our focused direct sales and marketing efforts and initiatives, will enable us to establish a presence in our markets and help to reduce the upfront costs of establishing a nationwide sales and distribution network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	32
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	To date, sales of our DispatchPlus service have been slower to ramp-up than our initial expectations for a number of reasons, including but not limited to, the performance of our indirect third-party sales representatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	longer initial sales cycle, and coverage gaps in certain markets due to delays in our deployment of planned sites that were not or have not yet been completed.&nbsp;&nbsp;On the positive front, our sales prospects are growing and initial feedback from early customers and prospects indicates strong interest in our DispatchPlus service offering.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, we are currently focusing our resources on the seven markets where we have commenced service.&nbsp;&nbsp;That focus includes trialing and implementing a number of sales and marketing initiatives and strategies aimed at increasing sales of our DispatchPlus service and developing a predictable sales funnel and process.&nbsp;&nbsp;These initiatives include:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Identifying and targeting high-value, small and medium-sized business customers that we believe will benefit from our DispatchPlus service;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Focusing our advertising and marketing efforts on communicating the benefits of our services to business customers in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	targeted market verticals;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Building
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and trialing a business development direct sales team in one of our seven markets and adding limited direct sales resources in the other markets;
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

	a centralized business development and telesales team to increase flow of qualified leads and sales across all of our market areas; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;

</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Beginning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to develop alternate sales channel strategies to identify new sources of sales and leads in our targeted market verticals;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We intend to continue to focus our efforts on the initial seven markets where we have commenced service until we determine which sales and marketing approaches produce the best results.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have, however, continued to prepare for the r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ollout of our DispatchPlus service in more than thirteen additional markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	by completing initial network designs and in some markets pursuing site development efforts, including site selection and lease negotiation.&nbsp;&nbsp;This approach will allow us to more quickly and effectively proceed with new market deployments when we determine it is best to do so.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also believe this approach will provide us with additional time and financial flexibility to refine our longer term strategies including those related to our Joint Petition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Concurrently with launching our DispatchPlus business, we are pursuing initiatives to increase the efficiency and capacity of the spectrum licenses we hold, including filing (together with the Enterprise Wireless Alliance) a Joint Petition for Rulemaking with the FCC proposing a realignment of a portion of the 900 MHz spectrum from narrowband to broadband.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have responded to all requests for information from the FCC and other interested parties, and we are currently awaiting FCC action.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FCC&#x2019;s action may take a number of forms ranging from:&nbsp;&nbsp;a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking, to a Notice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Inquiry, to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	dismissal of the Joint Petition without further action
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;To our knowledge, the FCC has not reached a decision on the Joint Petition. We currently believe that the most likely outcome is that the FCC will adopt a Notice of Inquiry as the next step in the process.&nbsp;&nbsp;We, however, do not know the content
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	scope of a potential Notice of Inquiry.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry is a vehicle for the FCC to gather additional information for the record.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the FCC elects to adopt a Notice of Inquiry, it could request
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	additional information and input on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	optimal use of the 900 MHz band generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry could also request information on the specific
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	issues and proposed solutions raised by us and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	commentators in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	proceeding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The adoption of a Notice of Inquiry does not mean that the FCC has denied our Joint Petition, or that our Joint Petition will not ultimately result in a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	continue to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believe in the merits of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	proposal,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Joint Petition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s past practices and policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nevertheless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, obtaining a favorable result from the FCC may take a significant amount of time and resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. Moreover, there is no assurance that the FCC will adopt our proposed rules, or ultimately approve our Joint Petition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition to this regulatory action, we are also pursuing a number of broadband and additional spectrum and wireless service opportunities, including acquiring additional spectrum to support our realignment efforts and the deployment of a future broadband network, attempting to build consensus with incumbents in the 900 MHz band, developing a strategic plan for our future deployment of a broadband or other wireless services in the 900 MHz band, and evaluating whether existing technologies and equipment can be used to support our spectrum initiatives and opportunities.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to our opportunities in the 900 MHz band, we are pursuing additional spectrum and related wireless service opportunities. The potential opportunities we have been exploring include the First Responder Network Authority (&#x201C;FirstNet&#x201D;), which involves government plans and a related process to provide spectrum and a substantial amount of funding for the build-out and operation of a dedicated Nationwide Public Safety Broadband Network (&#x201C;NPSBN&#x201D;) that also may be used, on a non-priority, excess capacity basis, to meet the wireless service needs of a variety of commercial customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no assurance, however, that we will be successful in our pursuit of spectrum opportunities related to FirstNet or any other spectrum opportunities that we identify and attempt to pursue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Prior to acquiring our 900 MHz spectrum, we were engaged in the development and sale of wireless communications applications, marketed primarily under the name pdvConnect.&nbsp;&nbsp;We primarily offer these applications indirectly to the end users of two Tier 1 wireless communications carriers in the United States and, until July 2015, one international wireless communications carrier under licensing agreements between these carriers and us.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also offer these applications directly to end users.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Basis of Presentation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our financial statements for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and our financial condition and results of operations reflect the following corporate events that have occurred during the periods presented below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Follow-on Offering.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	completed a registered follow-on public offering of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	common stock that resulted in the sale of 1,725,000 shares at a purchase price of $40.00 per share, which included 225,000 shares sold pursuant to the underwriters&#x2019; exercise of their over-allotment option.&nbsp;&nbsp;Net proceeds were approximately $64.8 million after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and offering expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mexico.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We marketed our pdvConnect product through an international Tier 1 carrier located in Mexico. In&nbsp;May&nbsp;2015, the agreement with the international carrier terminated and, upon termination of the agreement, except for any payments due to us, neither party has any further obligations under the agreement. Revenues from our int
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ernational carrier were $12,907
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$79,938 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$197,795&nbsp;&nbsp;for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Sprint APA
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On May&nbsp;13, 2014, we entered into the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an Asset Purchase Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to acquire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) FCC licenses to operate a nationwide dispatch network in the 900 MHz band and (ii) certain 900 MHz equipment (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Spectrum Assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from Sprint for a total of $100 million, including $90 million in cash and $10 million paid in 500,000 shares of our common stock (at a price equal to $20.00&nbsp;per share). Pursuant to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our agreement with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sprint, we delivered $13.5 million to Sprint as a deposit against our purchase of the Spectrum Assets following the close of our June 2014 private placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In September 2014, we obtained the necessary approvals from the FCC to transfer the FCC licenses from Sprint to us, and we completed the closing of the purchase and sale of the Spectrum Assets by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	issu
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	500,000 shares of our common stock and deliver
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the balance of the $90 million purchase price to Sprint.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	June 2014 Private Placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On June&nbsp;10, 2014, we completed the June 2014 private placement in which we sold 10,925,000 shares of common stock at a purchase price of $20.00 per share in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	transaction exempt from registration under the Securities Act. FBR Capital Markets&nbsp;&amp; Co. acted as the initial purchaser/placement agent for the June 2014 private placement. The net proceeds from the June 2014 private placement, after deducting our offering expenses and the payment of initial purchaser/placement agent discount or placement fees, were approximately $202&nbsp;million. At the closing of the June 2014 private placement, we placed approximately 96% of the proceeds from the June 2014 private placement (net of any initial purchaser&#x2019;s/placement agent&#x2019;s discount and placement fees) in the PDV Investor Trust, a Delaware statutory trust pending the Spectrum Closing. On September&nbsp;15, 2014, we completed the Spectrum Closing and the proceeds held in the PDV Investor Trust were distributed to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Reincorporation and Recapitalization.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the June 2014 private placement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we completed a number of actions, including:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT;TEXT-INDENT:11.55PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(i) the reincorporation of our Company from California to Delaware, which was effected on May&nbsp;30, 2014;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ii) the adoption of an amended and restated certificate of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws, which became effective immediately prior to the completion of the June 2014 private placement;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iii) the conversion of all outstanding shares of our Series AA Preferred Stock (the only outstanding class of preferred stock) into shares of our common stock on a one-for-one basis, and the conversion of our remaining options to purchase shares of our Series AA Preferred Stock into options to purchase shares of our common stock and the conversion of restricted stock units for shares of our Series AA Preferred Stock into restricted stock units for shares of our common stock, each on a one-for-one basis;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iv) a 33.11451201-for-1 reverse stock split of all of our outstanding common stock, which was effected immediately prior to the completion of the June 2014 private placement;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(v) the termination and exchange of outstanding warrants to purchase 661,581 shares of Series AA Preferred Stock into 29,809 shares of our common stock, which was completed immediately prior to the completion of the June 2014 private placement; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vi) the amendment of outstanding redeemable convertible promissory notes (the &#x201C;Redeemable Notes&#x201D;), in the aggregate principal amount of $1,016,956, to provide that the Redeemable Notes would automatically be converted into that number of shares of our common stock equal to (A)&nbsp;the sum of 140% of the outstanding principal amount plus the outstanding interest on such Redeemable Notes through the conversion date divided by (B)&nbsp;$20.00 per share, contingent upon the Spectrum Closing. Following the Spectrum Closing, the Redeemable Notes were converted into 77,733 shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Motorola Reseller Agreement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We entered into a reseller agreement with Motorola on May&nbsp;15, 2014, under which Motorola agreed to provide us with t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	heir state-of-the-art Motorola d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	igital
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	echnology that we intend to deploy as part of our nationwide network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
