<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Motorola Spectrum Leasing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Additionally, in September 2014, Motorola invested $10 million in our subsidiary PDV Spectrum Holding Company, LLC, that we formed to hold all of the 900 MHz spectrum we acquired from Sprint. Motorola&#x2019;s ownership interests in the subsidiary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	convertible into shares of our common stock at a price equal to $20.00 per share. Motorola is not entitled to any economics from the operations of our subsidiary. We also entered into a spectrum rights agreement pursuant to which we leased 900 MHz spectrum to Motorola. Upon executing the agreement, Motorola paid us $7.5 million as an upfront, fully-paid leasing fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Effectiveness of Registration Statement and Listing on The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Capital Market.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On January&nbsp;26, 2015, the SEC declared effective our registration statement on Form S-1 relating to the resale of 11,925,000 shares of common stock held by the selling stockholders (including 500,000 shares of common stock issuable upon the conversion of the Class B Units of our subsidiary, PDV Spectrum Holding Company, LLC issued to Motorola). We did not receive any proceeds from any sales by the selling stockholders. On February&nbsp;3, 2015, shares of our common stock were listed for trading on The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capital Market under the symbol &#x201C;PDVW.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Proceeds from the January 2015 Private Placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On January&nbsp;26, 2015, we completed a private placement with a secondary closing on January&nbsp;30, 2015. We sold 57,470 shares of common stock at a purchase price of $25.00 per share to certain accredited investors in reliance on exemptions from registration under the Securities Act. The net proceeds from the January 2015 private placement were approximately $1,386,000. The purpose of this private placement was to secure additional round lot stockholders to enable us to satisfy the initial listing standards of The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capital Market. We use
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The accompanying
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the United States of America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which require management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Accordingly, our actual results could differ from those estimates. Further, to the extent that there are differences between our estimates and our actual results, our future financial statement presentation, financial condition, results of operations and cash flows will be affected. We believe that the accounting policies discussed below are critical to understanding our historical performance, as these policies relate to the more significant areas involving our judgments and estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We believe that the areas described below are the most critical to aid in fully understanding and evaluating our reported financial results, as they require
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	management&#x2019;s most significant judgments in the application of accounting policy or in making estimates an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ssumptions that are inherently uncertain and that may change in subsequent periods.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our significant accounting policies are set forth in Note 2 to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our consolidated financial statements. Of those policies, we believe that the policies discussed below may involve a higher degree of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	judgment and may be more critical to an accurate reflection of our financial condition and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recognize revenue in the period that persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery of the product has occurred or services have been rendered,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	able to determine the amount of revenue and when the collection of such amount is considered probable.&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with the guidance provided in Accounting Standards Codification (&#x201C;ASC&#x201D;) Topic 605-45-45, Revenue Recognition &#x2013; Principal Agent Considerations,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	determined that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the primary obligor with respect to the service revenue derived from sales of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	software applications through its Tier I domestic carrier partners. As a result, revenue is recorded at the gross amount billed to end-user customers for sales through these carrier partners.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recognized service revenue for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	international carrier (which business relationship terminated in July 2015) on the net amount billed since
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	determined that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	not the primary obligor.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	also sell service and applications directly to end-users, which are billed and collected directly by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	us.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In September 2014, Motorola paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an upfront, fully-paid leasing fee of $7.5 million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	order to lease a portion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	wireless spectrum licenses. The payment of the fee is accounted for as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eferred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	evenue on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recognize leasing revenue in accordance with ASC Topic 840, Leases. The fee is amortized using the straight-line method over the lease term of approximately ten years, which represents the time period in which the benefits of the leased property are expected to be depleted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	evaluate certain transactions for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DispatchPlus service offering to determine whether they should be viewed as a Multiple Element Arrangemen
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	t provided in ASC Topic 605-25.&nbsp;&nbsp;Judgment is required to properly identify the accounting units of the multiple deliverable transactions and to determine the manner in which revenue should be allocated among the units of accounting.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Multiple deliverable arrangements are presumed to be bundled transactions, and the total consideration is measured and allocated to the separate transactions based on their relative selling price with certain limitations.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The relative selling price for each deliverable is determined using vendor-specific objective evidence (&#x201C;VSOE&#x201D;) of selling price or third-party evidence of such selling price if VSOE does not exist.&nbsp;&nbsp;If neither VSOE nor third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party eviden
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ce
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of selling price exist, the Company uses its best estimate of the selling price for the deliverable.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	determined that the rental of user devices in connection with service contracts for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DispatchPlus service a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	re multiple deliverable arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	35
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock compensation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For purposes of calculating stock-based compensation, we estimate the fair value of stock options using a Black-Scholes option
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pricing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	odel. The determination of the fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	option
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-based
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	utilizing the Black-Scholes model is affected by a number of assumptions, including expected volatility, expected life, risk-free interest rate and expected dividends.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he expected
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	term and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	volatility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is based on the historical volatility of our common
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	along with comparable public companies within our industry since we have a short history regarding th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ese
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	variable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The risk-free interest rate assumption is based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at the time of the grant for periods corresponding with the expected life of the options.&nbsp;&nbsp;T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he dividend yield assumption is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	zero since we have never paid and do not anticipate paying any cash dividends in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The fair value of restricted stock and performance units are measured based on the quoted closing market price for the stock at the date of grant. The compensation cost for restricted stock is recognized on a straight-line basis over the vesting period.&nbsp;&nbsp;The compensation cost for the performance units is recognized when the performance criteria are complete.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have not attributed tax benefits to the share-based compensation expense because we maintain a full valuation allowance for all net deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Property
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and equipment.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Property and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	equipment is stated at cost. Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shorter of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	estimated useful lives of the assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or the applicable lease term.&nbsp;&nbsp;The carrying amount at the balance sheet date of long-lived assets under construction in process includes construction costs to date on capital projects that have not been completed, assets being constructed that are not ready to be pla
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ced in service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and assets that are not currently in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;These costs will be transferred to property and equipment when substantially all of the activities necessary to prepare the assets for their intended use are completed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Depreciation commences upon completion.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Intangible Assets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets are wireless licenses that will be used to provide the exclusive right to utilize designated radio frequency spectrum to provide wireless communication services. While licenses are issued for only a fixed time, generally ten years, such licenses are subject to renewal by the FCC. License renewals have occurred routinely and at nominal cost. There are currently no legal, regulatory, contractual, competitive, economic or other factors that limit the useful life of the company&#x2019;s wireless licenses. As a result, the wireless licenses are treated as an indefinite-lived intangible asset.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	evaluate the useful life determination for wireless licenses each year to determine whether events and circumstances continue to support an indefinite useful life. The licenses are tested for impairment on an aggregate basis,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	since we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	will be utilizing the wireless licenses on an integrated basis as a part of developing our nationwide network.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consider estimates of valuation methods to perform the test of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fair values of wireless licenses annually
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including market based and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	discounted cash flow approach
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	es
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-Lived Asset Impairment.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We evaluate long-lived assets for impairment, other than intangible assets with indefinite lives, whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset group may not be recoverable. Asset groups are determined at the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of cash flows of other groups of assets and liabilities. When the carrying amount of a long-lived asset group is not recoverable and exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss is recognized equal to the excess of the asset group&#x2019;s carrying value over the estimated fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income taxes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We follow the liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this method, taxes consist of taxes currently payable plus those deferred due to temporary differences between the financial statement carrying amounts and the tax bases of certain assets and liabilities using tax rates expected to be in effect when the temporary differences reverse. A valuation allowance is provided when it is more likely than not that some portion or the entire deferred tax asset will not be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting for uncertainty in income taxes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recognize the effect of tax positions only when they are more likely than not to be sustained. Our management has determined that we had no uncertain tax positions that would require financial statement recognition or disclosure. We are no longer subject to U.S. federal, state or local income tax examinations for periods prior to 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	JOBS Act.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As an emerging growth company, or EGC, under the JOBS Act we are eligible for exemptions from various reporting requirements applicable to other public companies that are not EGCs, including, but not limited to:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Not being required to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Reduced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	disclosure obligations regarding executive compensation in our periodic reports, proxy statements and registration statements; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Exemptions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	from the requirements of holding a nonbinding advisory vote on executive compensation and stockholder approval of any golden parachute payments not previously approved.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As an EGC, we are also eligible to take advantage of the extended transition period provided in Section&nbsp;7(a)(2)(B) of the Securities Act, for complying with new or revised accounting standards. Thus, we could delay the adoption of certain accounting standards until those standards would otherwise apply to private companies. Nevertheless, we have elected not to avail ourselves of this extended transition period and, as a result, we will adopt new or revised accounting standards on the relevant dates on which adoption of such standards is required for other public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&#xFEFF;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comparison of the years ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following table sets forth our results of operations for the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6 and 2015 (&#x201C;Fiscal 2016&#x201D; and &#x201C;Fiscal 2015&#x201D;, respectively)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The period to period comparison of financial results is not necessarily indicative of financial results to be achieved in future periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">

</FONT>

	2.6

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for Fiscal 201

	2.8

	&nbsp;million for the Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The decrease can be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	attributed to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the termination of our agreement with our international carrier, $0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The remaining decrease was due to higher churn in our historical pdvConnect service offering partially offset by revenue from our DispatchPlus service offering.&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase of $0.3 million, or 84.6%, for the spectrum lease revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	resulted from the revenue derived from the spectrum lease to Motorola that began on September&nbsp;15, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Other revenue resulted from the equipment sales and rentals for our DispatchPlus business that began in Fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cost of revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Cost of revenue for Fiscal 2016 increased by $2.4 million, or 226.3%, to $3.5 million from $1.1 million for Fiscal 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase is attributable to the costs to maintain our launched PTT networks for our DispatchPlus business, $1.4 million, increased headcount costs to support the commercially launched PTT networks, $0.6 million, along with the costs of handsets sold, $0.2 million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	96.5%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to $
</FONT>

	0.1 m

	illion from $
</FONT>

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:25.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:11.98%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:25.50PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	126,759&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating revenues.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Service revenue decreased $0.76 million, or 21.5%, to $2.78 million for Fiscal 2015 from $3.54&nbsp;million for the Fiscal 2014. The decrease can be attributed to declines in our lower margin international business of $0.12 million or 59.6%.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our U.S. operations revenue declined over the prior year, which is attributable to higher customer churn. For Fiscal 2015, approximately 97% and 3% of our revenues were from domestic and international operations, respectively, with 100% of our revenues from international operations coming from Mexico. The decline in our operating revenues was partially offset by the spectrum lease to Motorola that began on September&nbsp;15, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For Fiscal 2015, service reve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nues from domestic operations decreased $0.64&nbsp;million, or 19.3%, to approximately $2.70&nbsp;million from $3.34 million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease can be attributed to higher customer churn. For Fiscal 2015, revenues from international operations decreased $0.12&nbsp;million, or 59.6%, to $0.08&nbsp;million from $0.20 million for Fiscal 2014. The decline can be attributed to a decreased focus on our international operations. During the first quarter of Fiscal 2015, we received notification from our international carrier that they would be terminating our service in the first quarter of Fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cost of revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Cost of revenue for Fiscal 2015 declined by approximately $0.06 million, or 5.4%, to $1.06&nbsp;million from $1.12 million for Fiscal 2014. The reduction in cost of revenue for the year was a result of lower domestic revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gross profit.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross profit decreased by $0.31&nbsp;million, or 12.7%, to $2.11&nbsp;million from $2.42&nbsp;million for Fiscal 2015. The primary driver was the decline of our gross profit from international operations, which revenue is recorded on a net basis, which decreased by $0.12&nbsp;million, or 59.6%, to approximately $0.08&nbsp;million from $0.20&nbsp;million for Fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	General and administrative expenses for Fiscal 2015 increased by $12.44&nbsp;million, or 1,343.6%, from $0.93 million for Fiscal 2014. The increase in general and administrative expenses for the year is primarily attributable to an increase in stock compensation expense of $6.88 million, associated with the grant of restricted stock units and stock options issued during the 2015 fiscal year primarily due to the actions approved by our Board of Directors in connection with our June 2014 private placement and recapitalization. Additionally, expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to our employees were higher by approximately $3.19 million for the year due to our planned increases in headcount in order to support our new business initiatives. Expenses relating to professional fees in connection with the June 2014 private placement, the January 2015 private placement, and our qualifying to become a publicly traded company were approximately $1.77 million for Fiscal 2015, along with $0.50 million related to other expenses incurred as a result of being a public company.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Sales and support expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Sales and support expenses increased by $0.43 million, or&nbsp;31.1%, to $1.81 million for Fiscal 2015 from $1.38 million for Fiscal 2014. The increase in expenses is due primarily to an increase in staff and headcount related costs related to the planned launch of our DispatchPlus business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Product development expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Product development expenses increased by $0.07 million, or 7.1%, to $1.00&nbsp;million for Fiscal 2015 from $0.93 million for Fiscal 2014. This increase in expense was due primarily to an increase in staff.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Depreciation and amortization expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation and amortization expenses increased by approximately $0.04 million for Fiscal 2015. The increase was the result of increased equipment placed in service during Fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Interest expense.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Interest expense for Fiscal 2015 increased by $0.25 million, or 75.4%, to $0.57 million from $0.33 million for Fiscal 2014. The increase was due to the accretion of $0.40 million in interest on our convertible promissory notes through the date of conversion.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Proceeds from the June 2014 Private Placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On June&nbsp;10, 2014, we completed a private placement in which we sold 10,925,000 shares of common stock at a purchase price of $20.00 per share to certain investors in reliance on exemptions from registration under the Securities Act. The net proceeds from the June 2014 private placement were approximately $202.0 million. We used $90.0 million of the net proceeds from the June 2014 private placement, plus $10.0 million in shares of our common stock, to acquire the Spectrum Assets from Sprint. In connection with the Spectrum Closing, PDV Spectrum Holding Company, LLC, our subsidiary, entered into an agreement with Motorola in which it agreed to lease a portion of the FCC licenses we acquired from Sprint in exchange for an upfront, fully-paid leasing fee of $7.5 million and a $10.0 million investment in the Class B Units of PDV Spectrum Holding Company, LLC. Motorola has the right at any time to convert its 500,000 Class B Units into 500,000 shares of our common stock, representing a conversion price of $20.00 per share. We also have the right to force Motorola&#x2019;s conversion into shares of our common stock on the occurrence of certain corporate events or at our election after September&nbsp;15, 2016. Motorola is not entitled to any assets, profits or distributions from the operations of our subsidiary. The Class B Units have no redemption or call provisions and can only be converted into shares of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Proceeds from the January 2015 Private Placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On January&nbsp;26, 2015, we completed a private placement with a secondary closing on January&nbsp;30, 2015. We sold 57,470 shares of common stock at a purchase price of $25.00 per share to certain accredited investors in reliance on exemptions from registration under the Securities Act. The net proceeds from the January 2015 private placement were approximately $1,386,000. The purpose of this private placement was to secure additional round lot stockholders to enable us to satisfy the initial listing standards of The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Capital Market. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	used
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We intend to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	establish our PTT network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ajor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	metropolitan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	arket
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	areas throughout t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;In Fiscal 2016, we commenced service in seven major metropolitan market areas, including Houston, Dallas, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Chicago, the greater New York area and Baltimore/Washington.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We estimate that the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initial capital cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to deploy our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in major metropolitan areas will range from $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1.5 million to $2.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which amount includes the cost of equipment, design and buildout of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	PTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	networks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	intend to continue to focus our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	efforts on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	seven markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	where
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	have commenced service until we prove out our DispatchPlus business model in those markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have, however,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	continued to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	prepare
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the rollout of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our DispatchPlus service in more than thirteen additional markets by completing initial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	network design
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in some markets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pursuing site development efforts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, including site selection and lease negotiation.&nbsp;&nbsp;This a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pproach will allow
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to more q
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	uickly and effectively proceed with new market deployments when we determine it is best to do so.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also believe this approach will provide us with additional time and financial flexibility to refine our longer term strategies including those related to our Joint Petition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our future capital requirements will depend on many factors: including the timing and amount of the revenues we generate from our DispatchPlus services and other product offerings, the timing and extent of expenditures to support the rollout of our PTT dispatch network
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the development of new service offerings, sales and marketing activities, the FCC r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	egulatory process we are pursuing to realign a portion of the 900 MHz spectrum from narrowband to broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the other broadband
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	initiatives we elect to pursue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. We believe our cash and cash equivalents on hand, including our available cash reserves, will be sufficient to satisfy our financial obligations through at least the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We cannot predict with certainty when, if ever, we will require additional capital to further fund our current business plan. Presently, we intend to cover our future operating expenses through cash on hand and from revenue derived primarily from our planned sales of our DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ervices and product offerings. With the recent commercial launch of markets (as noted above), revenues from our DispatchPlus business have just begun to be realized, and we have not recognized significant amounts of revenue from this business through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016. Nevertheless, we may experience greater than expected cash usage to support our operating activities and business plan and/or our revenues may be lower than, or take more time to develop than we anticipate. See &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Risk Factors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Annual Report
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or risks and uncertainties that could cause our operating costs to be more than we currently anticipate and/or our revenue and operating results to be lower than we currently anticipate. As a result, we cannot provide assurance that we will not require additional funding in the future. In addition, we intend to acquire businesses, technologies or spectrum or license technologies from third parties for or in connection with our spectrum initiatives.&nbsp;&nbsp;We may decide to raise additional capital through debt or equity financing to the extent we believe this is necessary to successfully complete these acquisitions or license these technologies or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pursue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	opportunities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. However, we cannot be sure that additional financing will be available if and when needed, or that, if available, we can obtain financing on terms favorable to us and our stockholders. Any failure to obtain financing when required would have a material adverse effect on our business, operating results, financial condition and liquidity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Warranties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our agreements with our customers generally include certain provisions for indemnifying them against liabilities if our serv
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ices infringe a third-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party&#x2019;s intellectual property rights or for other specified reasons.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contractual Obligations and Indebtedness
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We are obligated under certain lease agreements for office space. These leases expire on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 30, 2016, January 7, 2019, June 30, 2019 and May 31, 2020.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Rent expense amounted to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,057
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	443
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, $1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	55,531
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	13,920
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for Fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;For Fiscal 2016, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	684,277
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the total rent expense was classified in cost of revenue and the remainder of $373,16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was classified in operating expenses in the Consolidated Statements of Operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Total rent expense for Fiscal 2015 and 2014 was classified in operating expenses in the Consolidated Statements of Operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	We entered into multiple lease agreements for tower
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	site locations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to the new DispatchPlus business. The lease expiration dates r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ange from February&nbsp;28, 2020 to March 31, 2026.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s of March&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our contractual obligations, including estimated payments due by fiscal year, are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.24%;BORDER-TOP:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:3.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Indebtedness.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2015, the satisfaction of our indebtedness was as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We had a $3 million working capital line of credit with Brian McAuley, our Chairman, of which $1,470,000 had been drawn down as of June&nbsp;30, 2014. The line of credit was to expire June&nbsp;30, 2015 and all borrowings earned interest at 10%&nbsp;per annum. Commencing no later than September&nbsp;30, 2015, we were obligated to repay Mr.&nbsp;McAuley $50,000 per quarter of principal plus interest accrued for the quarter then ended until the entire principal w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	repaid. After the Spectrum Closing, we paid off the outstanding principal and accrued interest on this line of credit, with $1.3 million of such
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	repayment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	made through the issuance of 65,000 shares of our common stock, valued for this purpose at $20.00 per share and the balance in cash from the proceeds of the June 2014 private placement.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We issued a promissory note to Mr.&nbsp;McAuley, dated September&nbsp;1, 2010, as amended March&nbsp;31, 2011, in the principal amount of $540,000. This note earned interest at 10%&nbsp;per annum. No payments were due until June&nbsp;30, 2015, at which point
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	entire balance of principal and accrued interest was due and payable on demand of Mr.&nbsp;McAuley. After the Spectrum Closing, we paid off the outstanding principal and accrued interest on this note in cash.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We had issued convertible promissory notes (the &#x201C;Convertible Notes&#x201D;) to certain employees. The Convertible Notes earned interest of 10%&nbsp;per annum. Upon the election of the holder, principal and accrued interest due could convert into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	number
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of shares of our common stock equal to the quotient obtained by dividing the entire outstanding principal amount and accrued interest by $13.25 per share. The Convertible Notes were to mature on June&nbsp;30, 2015. In the event that the Convertible Notes were not converted into common stock and our Company achieved EBITDA in an amount equal to or greater than $5,000 for any quarter, within 30 days following such quarter, we agreed to use up to 20% of the EBITDA amount to pay the outstanding and unpaid principal and accrued interest to the note holders. After the Spectrum Closing, we paid off the outstanding principal and accrued interest on each of the Convertible Notes in cash from the proceeds of the June 2014 private placement.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	redeemable convertible promissory notes (the &#x201C;Redeemable Notes&#x201D;) with contingently issuable detachable warrants in the amount of $475,491 and $541,465 during Fiscal 2014 and Fiscal 2013, respectively. The Redeemable Notes earned interest at 10%&nbsp;per annum. The principal amount plus any accrued interest was payable on June&nbsp;30, 2015. In connection with the June 2014 private placement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the Redeemable Notes were amended on May&nbsp;14, 2014 to provide that the Redeemable Notes would automatically be converted into that number of shares of our common stock equal to the sum of 140% of the outstanding principal on the Redeemable Notes plus outstanding interest divided
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	by $20.00 per share upon the closing of our acquisition of the Spectrum Assets. Following the Spectrum Closing, the Redeemable Notes, were converted into 77,734 shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	IT
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_MARKETRISK">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	EM&nbsp;7A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our financial instruments consist of cash, cash equivalents, trade accounts receivable and accounts payable. We consider investments in highly liquid instruments purchased with original maturities of 90 days or less to be cash equivalents. Our primary exposure to market risk is interest income sensitivity, which is affected by changes in the general level of U.S. interest rates. However, because of the short-term nature of the highly liquid instruments in our portfolio, a 10% change in market interest rates would not be expected to have a material impact on our financial condition and/or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ITE
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_CONTROLSANDPROCEDURES">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	M&nbsp;9A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) are designed only to provide reasonable assurance that they will meet their objectives. Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our principal executive officer and principal financial officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness, as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures, as such term is defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;">
	Based upon that evaluation, the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have concluded that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures, as defined in Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e), were effective as of the end of the period covered by this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Inherent Limitations on Effectiveness of Controls
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer, do not expect that our disclosure controls or our internal control over financial reporting will prevent or detect all error and all fraud. A control system, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the control system&#x2019;s objectives will be met. The design of a control system must reflect the fact that there are resource constraints, and the benefits of controls must be considered relative to their costs. Further, because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that misstatements due to error or fraud will not occur or that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, have been detected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in decision-making can be faulty and that breakdowns can occur because of simple error or mistake. Controls can also be circumvented by the individual acts of some persons, by collusion of two or more people, or by management override of the controls. The design of any system of controls is based in part on certain assumptions about the likelihood of future events, and there can be no assurance that any design will succeed in achieving its stated goals under all potential future conditions. Projections of any evaluation of controls effectiveness to future periods are subject to risks. Over time, controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions or deterioration in the degree of compliance with policies or procedures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	42
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Management&#x2019;s Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company's management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) of the Exchange Act).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Internal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;">
	control over financial reporting is a process designed under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our principal executive officer and principal financial officer, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 5PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Management conducted an assessment of the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting based on the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission in Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework (2013 Framework). Based on this assessment, management determined that, as of March 31, 2016, the Company maintained effective internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Attestation Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	This Annual Report on Form 10-K does not include an attestation report of our independent registered public accounting firm due to the deferral allowed under the JOBS Act for emerging growth companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) or 15d-15(d) under the Exchange Act) during the period covered by this report that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<TR>

	Name
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:09.10%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:11.25PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Age
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The business address for our directors and executive officers is c/o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pdvWireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, Inc., 3 Garret Mountain Plaza, Suite 401, Woodland Park, New Jersey 07424.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Brian D. McAuley
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;McAuley has served as our Chairman of the Board since 2004. Mr.&nbsp;McAuley is a co-founder of Nextel Communications, Inc. and held senior executive positions at Nextel from its inception in 1987 until 1996, including seven years as President and Chief Executive Officer. Upon leaving Nextel, he joined Imagine Tile, Inc., a custom tile manufacturer, where he served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer from 1996 to 1999 and where he continues to serve as Chairman. He also served as President and Chief Executive Officer of NeoWorld Communications, Inc., a wireless telecommunications company, from 1999 until the sale of that company to Nextel in 2003. Mr.&nbsp;McAuley is a certified public accountant and, prior to co-founding Nextel, his positions included Chief Financial Officer of Millicom Incorporated, Corporate Controller at Norton Simon Inc. and Manager at Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP. He also currently serves on the board of directors of United Rentals (NYSE: URI). Mr.&nbsp;McAuley has a Bachelor of Business Administration Degree from Adelphi University and is a member of various finance and telecommunications industry organizations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe Mr.&nbsp;McAuley is qualified to serve on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on his prior experience in founding, building and serving as an executive officer at leading telecommunications companies, his prior experience in building a nationwide dispatch network at Nextel and his experience serving on the board of directors of other private and public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Morgan E. O&#x2019;Brien.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien has served as a member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since April 2012, and as Vice&nbsp;Chairman since May 2014. From January 2009 to present, Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien has served as an independent consultant to several wireless start-ups and as a member of the board of directors of Global Telecom and Technology, Inc. As the co-founder and chairman of Nextel Communications, Inc., Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien led the creation of the first all-digital nationwide wireless network (the Nextel National Network) and brought PTT communication to the mass business and consumer market. After the merger of Nextel with Sprint, he was a co-founder of Cyren Call Communications, where he served until January 2009. Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien was recognized in 1987 as New Jersey Entrepreneur of the Year and was voted the RCR Person of the Year in 1993 and again in 2006. In 2005, he was inducted into the Washington, DC Business Hall of Fame and in 2007 he was named a Fellow of the Radio Club of America and was named by Fierce Wireless as &#x201C;one of the top U.S. wireless innovators of all time.&#x201D; Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien has also served on a number of boards of other public companies including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Sprint Nextel and Williams Telecommunications. He also serves on the board of several private companies and charitable organizations. Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien is a graduate of Georgetown University and received his law degree from Northwestern University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien is qualified to serve on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on his prior experience in founding, building and serving as an executive officer at Nextel and Cyren Call Communications, his prior experience in building a nationwide dispatch network at Nextel, his expertise in FCC licensing and compliance matters and his experience serving on the board of directors of other private and public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
