<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	John C. Pescatore.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore has served as our President, Chief Executive Officer and a member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since August 2004. He is a seasoned telecommunications executive with particular expertise in start-up and rapidly growing companies. Prior to his current role as our President and Chief Executive Officer, he was Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of NeoWorld. NeoWorld was founded to develop and launch a nationwide dispatch system and held spectrum in major markets throughout the United States. The company was successfully sold to Nextel Communications in 2003. Prior to that, Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore was Executive Vice President of Operations with Expanets, Inc., one of the fastest growing voice and data communications solutions and services companies in the United States. He was one of the key architects in building Expanets and saw the business through enormous growth by strategic acquisitions. Prior to that, Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore was part of the team involved in the start-up of Nextel Communications, where he held numerous senior leadership positions including Vice President of Operations, President of the Two-Way Radio Division and President of the New&nbsp;York Area during its digital system rollout. Prior to Nextel, Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore was a consultant with Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Touche. He earned his undergraduate degree in accounting from New York University and earned his certified public accountant certification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore is qualified to serve on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on his service as an executive at leading telecommunications companies, his expertise in the dispatch network market and his financial and accounting expertise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Timothy Gray.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Gray joined the Company as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Chief Financial Officer in June 2014. From November 2011 to May 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Gray served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of MedImmune, Inc. and then served as Senior Vice President of Finance for MedImmune&#x2019;s Specialty Care Group until November 2013. Mr.&nbsp;Gray also served in various other finance roles at MedImmune since April 2008. Prior to joining MedImmune, Mr.&nbsp;Gray served in finance positions at AOL and Nextel and started his career at Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; &nbsp;Touche&nbsp;LLP. He is also a member of the Audit Committee of the Children&#x2019;s Inn at the National Institutes of Health. Mr.&nbsp;Gray holds a BBA in Accounting from the University of Notre Dame and is a certified public accountant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Frank Creede
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	, P.E
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Creede has served as our Chief
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Technology
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Officer since 2003. He has led the strategy, development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, buildout
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and operation of our enterprise focused,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	push-to-talk network and DispatchPlus application platform
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. Mr.&nbsp;Creede is a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	member emeritus and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	former board member of the San Diego Tech Coast Angels and an angel investor in over 10&nbsp;Southern California emerging high
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	tech companies. From 1986 to 2002, Mr.&nbsp;Creede was the Chairman, President&nbsp;and Chief Executive Officer&nbsp;of Logic Innovations, Inc., which he founded and which was acquired by Xyratex Ltd
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(a division of IBM)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in 1999
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in a transaction negotiated by Mr. Creede
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. He also founded Staffing Innovations, LLC, a technical contract outsourcing business in 1997, which was acquired in 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Creede is a volunteer mentor at the Chairman&#x2019;s Roundtable, and a volunteer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	at EvoNexus on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the NextStage committee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr. Creede is a registered Professional Engineer,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	holds a Bachelor&#x2019;s of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	University of California at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Davis and he has completed coursework for the MBA program at San Diego State University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Leon Frazier.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Frazier
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	joined the Company as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Chief Sales and Marketing Officer in June 2014. Prior to joining us, he conducted an independent consulting practice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since&nbsp;May 2012. In April 2010, he was recruited to start Bloomberg Government Sales and Marketing as Head of Sales and served in that role until May 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Frazier previously served in various roles for Sprint Corporation, including Vice President of Public Sector Business (which included&nbsp;state and&nbsp;local&nbsp;government,&nbsp;education,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	utilities,&nbsp;healthcare
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	d&nbsp;federal&nbsp;government), and&nbsp;Senior Vice President of Enterprise and Public Sector (which also included construction, manufacturing, professional services and distribution) from September 2005 until his retirement from Sprint in 2008. Prior to joining Sprint, Mr.&nbsp;Frazier was Vice President of Public Sector at Nextel, which position he held since 2001 after joining Nextel in 1997.&nbsp;&nbsp;During his tenure at Nextel, he designed and implemented&nbsp;a corporation accounts program which was responsible for sales to 375 of the Fortune 500&nbsp;companies. Mr.&nbsp;Frazier has more than 33 years of experience in the telecommunications industry, starting in 1981 at RCA where he was a Senior Vice President with subsequent positions at General Electric and Mitel Business Telephone Systems,&nbsp;where he was Vice President and General Manager of the North American Division. Mr.&nbsp;Frazier graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University in 1971 with a&nbsp;Bachelor&#x2019;s Degree&nbsp;in Business Management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Richard E. Rohmann.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Rohmann is one of our co-founders and is our Secretary and Executive Vice President focused on the development of our technology platform, and has filled such roles since 2004. Mr.&nbsp;Rohmann previously served as a director on&nbsp;our Board&nbsp;from 2004 until&nbsp;May&nbsp;2014. Mr.&nbsp;Rohmann was also our President from 1997 until 2003. He designed and developed our first two commercial software products. Mr.&nbsp;Rohmann created the database schema and user interface for the first commercial version of our series of telecommunications services that enable wireless PTT dictation and documentation from mobile phones. He is a co-inventor on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	eleven granted U.S. and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	international patents. Before co-founding our Company, he served for nine years as Vice President of Operations and Vice President of Asset Management for The Lomas Santa Fe Group, a privately held real estate owner/developer. Prior to that, he served as Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of HomeVest Real Estate Securities, and President of HHC Mortgage Corporation and HHC Ma
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	nagement Company,&nbsp;which were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;real estate syndication affiliates of the former Home Federal S &amp; L. His military service includes 4-1/2 years as an Aircraft Maintenance Officer in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	United States Air Force. He holds an MBA in finance from San Diego State University and a Bachelor&#x2019;s &nbsp;Degree in Zoology,&nbsp;Mathematics, and&nbsp;Chemistry from the University of Colorado, which he attended as a Boettcher Scholar.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Thomas Sidman.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Sidman joined the Company as&nbsp;our&nbsp;Chief Legal Officer in June 2015.&nbsp;Prior to joining our Company, from 2009 to&nbsp;June&nbsp;2015, and from 2003 to 2006, Mr.&nbsp;Sidman provided business and strategic consulting and advisory services to domestic and international telecommunications companies.&nbsp;He was a co-founder and served as a senior executive for Cyren Call Communications Corporation from 2006 to 2009. Cyren Call&#x2019;s principal mission and focus was advocating for and architecting a nationwide advance generation mobile wireless broadband network for priority use by public safety personnel in the United States.&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Sidman served as General Counsel of Nextel from October 1994 until early 2001, and thereafter served as Senior Legal Advisor to Nextel until April 2003.&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Sidman obtained&nbsp;his undergraduate degree from the University of Virginia with a Bachelor&#x2019;s &nbsp;Degree&nbsp;in Economics and Psychology.&nbsp;He received his law degree from The University of Virginia School of Law and subsequently, his graduate business degree from The George Washington University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Robert Schwartz.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr. Schwartz joined the Company as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Chief Strategy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Development Officer in August 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to joining our Company, beginning in October 2013, Mr. Schwartz served as Chief Executive Officer&nbsp;of STI Brasil, LLC, a company focused on developing shared fiber infrastructure for wireless operators in Brazil.&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to STI, from November 2009 to September 2013, Mr. Schwartz&nbsp;served as Managing Director of Unison Site Management, during which Unison acquired and managed cell site easements throughout the United States and sold its site portfolio to American Tower.&nbsp;&nbsp;From June 2006 to October 2009, Mr. Schwartz was Managing Partner of Woodmont Partners LLC, a strategic consultancy to telecom, media and technology companies including software, mobile and cable companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;Earlier
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr. Schwartz was Executive Vice President of IDT Telecom f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	rom
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2001 to 2006, and led Corporate Development, Product Management, and&nbsp;the Mobile&nbsp;Division.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 1996, Mr. Schwartz joined The Associated Group to launch Teligent, and became Teligent&#x2019;s Senior Vice President of Corporate Development, leading functions including strategy, capital markets, investor relations and M&amp;A activities through the startup, initial public offering, and the sale&nbsp;to&nbsp;Liberty Media.&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr. Schwartz&nbsp;also served as Director of Corporate Development at Nextel&nbsp;where he was responsible for supporting&nbsp;key strategy, M&amp;A, and capital markets initiatives, including the strategic investment&nbsp;in&nbsp;Nextel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	by Craig McCaw&#x2019;s Eagle River in 1996.&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr. Schwartz holds&nbsp;an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a Bachelor&#x2019;s Degree in Business Administration from George Washington University&#x2019;s School of Governmental Business.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	T. Clark Akers.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Akers joined our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	upon the completion of our June 2014 private placement. He has been a Managing Director
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, SBIC Funds Placement Divisio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	n at FBR &amp; Co., a Washington D.C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. based investment banking firm since September 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	His responsibilities at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	FBR &amp; Co.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	include raising capital for Small Business Investment Company (SBIC) funds for experienced U.S. investment managers.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Prior to FBR &amp; Co., Mr. Akers was a Managing Director at Commerce Street Capital, a Dallas based investment banking firm.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Akers serves on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	dvisory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	b
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard of Pharos Capital Group, a private equity firm based in Nashville and Dallas.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr. Akers serves on the board of the Fred Jones Companies, the automotive affiliate of Hall Capital, an Oklahoma City based family office.&nbsp;&nbsp;He also serves on the advisory board of Hall Capital Partners, the private equity affiliate of Hall Capital.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Akers also serves on the Board of Managers and is a founder and Vice President of Continuum 700 LLC, a wireless start-up that has acquired ten 700 MHz A Block licenses covering a population of approximately 12&nbsp;million people. In preparation to bid on those licenses in a 2008 FCC 700
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	MHz spectrum auction, Mr.&nbsp;Akers and his partners raised $68 million of capital for Continuum 700 LLC. Mr.&nbsp;Akers recently served as Vice Chairman of Intechra, the largest electronic waste and asset disposal company in the U.S. As a founder of Intechra, Mr.&nbsp;Akers raised $50 million of equity that was necessary for the organic and acquisitive growth which marked Intechra&#x2019;s rise to leadership in the e-waste business. Additionally, he was responsible for recruiting key members of Intechra&#x2019;s management team. Following those initiatives, he worked closely with the sales team on targeted Fortune 100 business development efforts. Mr.&nbsp;Akers&#x2019; tenure with Intechra began in 2004
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and ended in 2009. Prior to Intechra, Mr.&nbsp;Akers served as Senior Vice President of External Affairs for TeleCorp PCS, Inc., the ninth largest wireless phone company in the U.S. before its acquisition by AT&amp;T Wireless in 2002.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr. Akers holds Series 7, Series 63 and 24 License Registrations with the National Association of Securities Dealers, Inc.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Akers received his Bachelor of Arts degree from Vanderbilt University in 1979.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>

	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on his prior experience as an executive in the telecommunications industry, his experience in providing fund raising and advisory services to growth companies, and his knowledge of the capital markets.

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Andrew Daskalakis.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Daskalakis has served as a member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since 2004. Mr.&nbsp;Daskalakis currently serves as President of AMK International, Inc., an investment fund that he founded over 15 years ago. He has over 30 years of experience in wireless communications and has successfully operated a dispatch radio business. A wireless industry pioneer, he has held engineering management positions with AT&amp;T&#x2019;s Bell Labs where he was co-inventor of the Cellular Telephone System. He has also held senior executive positions with Motorola, Satellite Business Systems and was President and CEO of Cellular Telephone Co. He has also served as a consultant for Nextel Communications. Mr.&nbsp;Daskalakis received a BSEE degree from the Drexel University and a MSEE degree from New York University.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Peter Schiff.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Schiff has served as a member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since August 2004. He also currently serves as Managing Partner of Northwood Ventures LLC and Northwood Capital Partners LLC, a venture capital firm, which he founded in 1983. Prior to founding Northwood Ventures LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Schiff worked in the private equity division of E.M. Warburg, Pincus&nbsp;&amp; Co., and previously had been an officer in the corporate division of Chemical Bank (now JPMorgan Chase&nbsp;&amp; Co.). He serves as a director of many of Northwood&#x2019;s portfolio companies. Mr.&nbsp;Schiff graduated from Lake Forest College and received an M.B.A. from University of Chicago&#x2019;s Booth School of Business with concentrations in Finance and Marketing. In 2009, he was awarded the honorary degree of Doctor of Laws by the Lake Forest College after serving as a trustee for 16 years, culminating in being its Chairman. Mr.&nbsp;Schiff also serves as a trustee and secretary of Hofstra University and as a member of the Joint Board of Overseers of the Hofstra North Shore &#x2013; LIJ School of Medicine. Northwood Ventures was an early investor in several enterprise focused carriers including Nextel Communications, Dispatch Communications and NeoWorld.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe Mr.&nbsp;Schiff is qualified to serve on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on his experience in advising and investing in growth companies, his knowledge of the capital markets and his experience serving as a director on other boards of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	John C. Sites Jr.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Sites has served as a member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	since August 2004. He has been a partner at Wexford Capital since 2008, and joined Wexford Capital in 2006, where he focuses on private and public equity investing. Prior to joining Wexford in 2006, he was a general partner of Daystar Special Situations Fund and Rock Creek Partners II, Ltd for ten years. From 1981 to 1995, Mr.&nbsp;Sites was employed by Bear Stearns&nbsp;&amp; Co., Inc. where he reached the position of Executive Vice President and was a member of the board of directors. While at Bear Stearns, Mr.&nbsp;Sites established the firm&#x2019;s mortgage and asset-backed department, served on the firm&#x2019;s executive and compensation committees, was co-head of the taxable fixed income group and oversaw Bear Stearns Asset Management and the Financials Institutions Group. From 1974 to 1981, Mr.&nbsp;Sites worked at Trading Company of the West, First Pennco Securities and Morgan, Keegan&nbsp;&amp; Company. Mr.&nbsp;Sites holds a BA in economics from Rhodes College and is a member of Phi Beta Kappa.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We believe Mr.&nbsp;Sites is qualified to serve on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	based on experience in investing in private and public growth companies, his knowledge of the capital markets and his experience serving as a director on other boards of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Governance of Our Company
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We seek to maintain high standards of business conduct and corporate governance, which we believe are fundamental to the overall success of our business, serving our stockholders well and maintaining our integrity in the marketplace. Our corporate governance guidelines and code of business conduct, together with our Amended and Restated Certificate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Incorporation,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Amended and Restated Bylaws and the charters
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for each of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board committees, form the basis for our corporate governance framework.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We also are subject to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, the rules and regulations of the SEC and the corporate governance rules of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has established three standing committees to assist it in fulfilling its responsibilities to the Company and its stockholders: the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Corporate Governance Guidelines:&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our corporate governance guidelines are designed to help ensure effective corporate governance of our Company. Our corporate governance guidelines cover topics including, but not limited to, director qualification criteria, director responsibilities, director compensation, director orientation and continuing education, communications from stockholders to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard, succession planning and the annual evaluations of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and its committees. Our corporate governance guidelines are reviewed by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and revised when appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board of Directors:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	currently consists of seven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	members. The number of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board can be determined from time to time by action of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our Board has determined that our four non-employee directors, including Messrs. Akers, Daskalakis, Schiff and Sites, each meet the independence standards established by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Stock Market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;and the applicable independence&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	rules and regulations of the SEC, including the rules relating to the independence of the members of our Audit Committee and Compensation Committee.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Board considers that a director is independent when the director is not an officer or employee of the Company or its subsidiaries, does not have any relationship which would, or could reasonably appear to, materially interfere with the independent judgment of such director, and the director otherwise meets the independence requirements under the listing standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Stock Market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and the rules and regulations of the SEC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believes its members collectively have the experience, qualifications, attributes and skills to effectively oversee the management of our Company, including a high degree of personal and professional integrity, an ability to exercise sound business judgment on a broad range of issues, sufficient experience and background to have an appreciation of the issues facing our Company, a willingness to devote the necessary time to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	their Board and committee duties, a commitment to representing the best interests of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Company and our stockholders and a dedication to enhancing stockholder value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Committees of our Board of Directors:&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has established three committees:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Each of these committees consists of three members, each of whom satisfies the independence standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Committee.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is comprised of three of our independent directors, T. Clark Akers, Peter Schiff and John C. Sites, each of whom is able to read and understand fundamental financial statements, including our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	balance sheet,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	statement of operations, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	cash flow statement as required by the rules of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market. Mr.&nbsp;Akers is the chairperson of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The functions of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	include the retention of our independent registered public accounting firm, reviewing and approving the planned scope, proposed fee arrangements and results of our Company&#x2019;s annual audit, reviewing the adequacy of our Company&#x2019;s accounting and financial controls and reviewing the independence of our Company&#x2019;s independent registered public accounting firm. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has determined that each member of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee is an &#x201C;independent director&#x201D; under the listing standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market and the applicable rules and regulations of the SEC.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has also determined that each of T. Clark Akers, Peter Schiff and John C. Sites is an &#x201C;audit committee financial expert&#x201D; within the applicable requirements of the SEC. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee is governed by a written charter approved by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, which complies with the applicable provision of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and related rules of the SEC and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee is comprised of three of our independent directors, Peter Schiff, John C. Sites and Andrew Daskalakis. Mr.&nbsp;Schiff is the chairperson of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee. The functions of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee include the approval of the compensation offered to our executive officers and recommendation to the full board the compensation to be offered to our directors. In accordance with the listing standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee will evaluate the independence of each compensation consultant, outside counsel and advisor retained by or providing advice to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has determined that each of Messrs. Schiff, Sites and Daskalakis is an &#x201C;independent director&#x201D; under the listing standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market, including the additional requirements that apply to members of the Compensation Committee. In addition, the members of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee qualify as &#x201C;non-employee directors&#x201D; for purposes of Rule 16b-3 under the Exchange Act and as &#x201C;outside directors&#x201D; for purposes of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. The Compensation Committee is governed by a written charter approved by our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	N
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ominating and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	orporate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	G
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	overnance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee is comprised of three of our independent directors, Andrew Daskalakis, T. Clark Akers and Peter Schiff. Mr.&nbsp;Daskalakis is the chairperson of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. The functions of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	include the identification, recruitment and nomination of candidates for our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and its committees, making recommendations to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	concerning the structure, composition and functioning of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and its committees (including the reporting channels through which our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	receives information and the quality and timeliness of the information), developing and recommending to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	corporate governance guidelines applicable to our Company and annually reviewing and recommending changes (as necessary or appropriate), overseeing the annual evaluation of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	effectiveness and performance, and periodically conducting an individual evaluation of each director. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has determined that each member of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	will be an &#x201C;independent director&#x201D; under the listing standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Market. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is governed by a written charter approved by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation:&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	No member of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Compensation Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	has at any time been our employee. Except as set forth herein, none of our executive officers serves, or has served during the last fiscal year, as a member of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board or Compensation Committee of any other entity that has one or more executive officers serving as a member of our Board or our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Code of Business Conduct and Ethics:&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	adopted a code of business conduct that applies to our officers, directors and employees. Among other matters, our code of business conduct is designed to deter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	unlawful or unethical behavior
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and to promote the following
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Prohibiting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	conflicts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of interest (including protecting corporate opportunities);
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Any waiver of the code of business conduct and ethics for our executive officers, directors or employees may be made only by our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and will be promptly disclosed as required by law or stock exchange rules. We have posted a copy of our code of business conduct and ethics, and intend to post amendments to this code, on our website at http://www.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pdvwireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.com, as permitted under SEC rules and regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board Leadership Structure:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;McAuley serves as Chairman of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard has determined that separating the positions of Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board is in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders at this time.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believes our leadership structure enhances the accountability of our Chief Executive Officer to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard and encourages balanced decision making. In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	believes that this structure provides an environment in which its independent directors are fully informed, have significant input into the content of board meetings and are able to provide objective and thoughtful oversight of management.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	also separated the roles in recognition of the differences in responsibilities. While our Chief Executive Officer is responsible for the day-to-day leadership of the Company, the Chairman of the Board provides guidance to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard and sets the agenda for board meetings. The Chairman of the Board also provides performance feedback on behalf of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard to our Chief Executive Officer.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	intends to carefully evaluate from time to time whether our Chief Executive Officer and Chairman positions should remain separate based on what the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard believes is best for the Company and its stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Board Oversight of Risk:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is actively involved in the oversight of risks that could affect the Company.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	as a whole has responsibility for risk oversight of the Company&#x2019;s risk management policies and procedures, with reviews of certain areas being conducted by the relevant board committee.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	satisfies this responsibility through reports by each committee chair regarding the committee&#x2019;s considerations and actions, as well as through regular reports directly from management responsible for oversight of particular risks within the Company. Specifically,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	committees address the following risk areas:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Committee is responsible for overseeing the management of risks related to, the retention and motivation of the Company&#x2019;s executives and their compensation plans and arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Audit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Committee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	discusses with management the Company&#x2019;s major financial risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Nominating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and Corporate Governance Committee considers risks related to regulatory and compliance matters.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	encourages management to promote a corporate culture that incorporates risk management into the Company&#x2019;s day-to-day business operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Communications with the Board of Directors:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	desires that the views of stockholders will be heard by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard, its committees or individual directors, as applicable, and that appropriate responses will be provided to stockholders on a timely basis. Stockholders wishing to formally communicate with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	B
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oard committee, the independent directors as a group or any individual director may send communications directly to the Company at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pdvWireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, Inc., 3 Garret Mountain Plaza, Suite 401, Woodland Park, New Jersey&nbsp;07424, Attention: Corporate Secretary. All clearly marked written communications, other than unsolicited advertising or promotional materials, are logged and copied, and forwarded to the director(s) to whom the communication was addressed. Please note that the foregoing communication procedure does not apply to (i)&nbsp;stockholder proposals pursuant to Exchange Act Rule 14a-8 and communications made in connection with such proposals or (ii)&nbsp;service of process or any other notice in a legal proceeding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	IT
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_EXECUTIVECOMPENSATION">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EM&nbsp;11.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following tables summarize information concerning the compensation awarded to, earned by, or paid for services rendered in all capacities by our named executive officers during Fiscal 2016 (the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016) and Fiscal 2015 (the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015).&nbsp;&nbsp;As an emerging growth company, our named executive officers include:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	John C. Pescatore, our principal executive officer, and Morgan E. O&#x2019;Brien
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and Robert Schwartz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our two most highly compensated executive officers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(other than our principal executive officer)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	who were serving as executive officers at the end of Fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, as an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	emerging growth company, we have elected to adopt the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	reduced compensation disclosure requirements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	permitted under the JOBS Act.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	have not included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a compensation discussion and analysis section discussing the compensation of our executive officers or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	proxy proposals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	seeking approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers or seeking approval for the frequency at which we would include the advisory vote in our proxy statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Historically, we have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	been engaged in the development and sale of mobile resource management applications
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In June 2014, we completed a private placement financing in which we raised net proceeds of approximately $202.0 million to fund our acquisition of spectrum licenses and certain other assets from Sprint Corporation and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	deploy a nationwide dispatch network.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with this financing, we completed a recapitalization of our company and begin to hire a number of our executive officers and key employees.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In September 2014, we secured the necessary FCC approvals and completed our acquisition of the spectrum licenses and related assets from Sprint.&nbsp;&nbsp;In February 2015, we became a public reporting company and listed our common stock for trading on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Stock Market.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are now focused on deploying our PTT networks in major market areas throughout the United States and pursuing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	broadb
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and spectrum opportunities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, including, but not limited to, a FCC regulatory process aimed at the realignment of our spectrum to be able to deploy broadband technologies to enterprises.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our Compensation Committee reviews and approves all compensation decisions relating to our executive officers, including our named executive officers, and oversees and administers our executive compensation program.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our independent directors acting as a Special Committee established by the Board of Directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	effectively served as the compensation committee and approved
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a number of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decisions during Fiscal 2015 in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	connection with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the recapitalization of the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;June 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	private placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our Compensation Committee is focused on designing a compensation program that attracts, retains, and incentivizes talented executives, motivates them to achieve our key financial, operational, and strategic goals, and rewards them for superior performance. It is also focused on ensuring that our compensation program aligns our executive officers&#x2019; interests with those of our stockholders by rewarding their achievement of specific corporate and individual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	performance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	goals.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In June 2014, our Special Committee established our initial executive compensation program, consisting of: (i) an annual basis salary; (ii) a performance-based cash award plan consisting of an annual cash bonus based on the achievement of company and individual performance goals; and (iii) a long-term equity award plan consisting of the grant of time-based stock options.&nbsp;&nbsp;We were a private company at this time, and had just completed a recapitalization and the private placement in which we raised funds to purchase our 900 MHz spectrum.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, the compensation offered to our executive officers reflected our recapitalization and the fact that many of our executive officers and key employees were new hires and received their initial equity awards upon joining our company.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In preparation for becoming a publicly traded company in early 2015, the Compensation Committee retained Arthur J. Gallagher &amp; Co. to evaluate our compensation program and the compensation we offered to our executive officers following the recapitalization of the Company and our June 2014 private placement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Arthur J. Gallagher &amp; Co. also assisted the Compensation Committee in designing an executive severance plan for our executive officers and other key employees, including evaluating the severance terms offered by a peer group of newly public telecomm and technology companies.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2015, the Compensation Committee retained Pearl Meyer &amp; Partners, LLC, as its independent compensation consultant, to assist it in selecting an appropriate peer group of public companies for purposes of executive compensation and to evaluate our compensation program and the compensation levels we currently offer to our executive officers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on our peer group and the advice of Pearl Meyer, the Compensation Committee determined that the equity awards issued to our executive officers under our long-term equity award plan should be changed to a combination of time-based and performance-based equity awards.&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2016, the Compensation Committee issued time-based and performance-based equity awards to our executive officers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although these equity awards were granted during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 and are included in the compensation tables below, the Compensation Committee granted these equity awards as the long-term equity award component of the compensation our executive officers will receive for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Compensation Committee does not intend to grant any additional equity awards under our long-term incentive plan for fiscal 2017.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	Page
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The following table summarizes information concerning the compensation awarded to, earned by, or paid for services rendered in all capacities by our named executive officers during the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and March&nbsp;31, 2016. The compensation described in this table does not include medical, group life insurance, or other benefits which are available generally to all of our salaried empl
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	oyees.

	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Narrative to Summary Compensation Table
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The comp
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ensation program established&nbsp;for&nbsp;the&nbsp;Company&#x2019;s executive officers&nbsp;consisted of the following elements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for fiscal years 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Base Salary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	: The base salaries of our named executive officers depend on their job responsibilities, the market rate of compensation paid by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	companies&nbsp;in our industry for similar positions, our financial position, and the strength of our business
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	performance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. Base salaries provide a fixed means of compensation in order to attract and retain talent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ed executive officers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Performance-Based Cash Awards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	: As part of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	compensation program,&nbsp;our executive officers and other key employees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	are eligible to participate in a performance-based cash award program.&nbsp;The annual performance-based cash awards are based on the&nbsp;executive officer&#x2019;s&nbsp;individual&nbsp;performance&nbsp;and the Company&#x2019;s actual performance compared to the corporate goals&nbsp;approved by the Compensation Committee. Following the end of each fiscal year, the Compensation Committee is responsible for determining the bonus amount payable to&nbsp;an&nbsp;executive officer based on that executive officer&#x2019;s&nbsp;individual performance&nbsp;during the fiscal year and its determination of the Company&#x2019;s actual performance compared to the corporate goals&nbsp;established&nbsp;for&nbsp;that fiscal year.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Long-Term Equity Awards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	:&nbsp;&nbsp;Equity&nbsp;ownership by our executive officers and key employees encourages them to create long-term value and aligns their interests with those of our stockholders.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	During fiscal 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,&nbsp;our executive&nbsp;compensation program provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for the issuance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	time-based
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	stock options&nbsp;under our 2014 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;The stock option awards issued in fiscal 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reflected our recapitalization and the fact that many of our executive officers and key employees were new hires and received their initial equity awards upon joining our company in fiscal 2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_COMPENSATIONOFNAMEDEXECUTIVEOFFICERS">
</A>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1">
