<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Compensation Committee elected not to grant equity awards to our executive officers and key employees at the beginning of fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In August 2015, the Compensation Committee retained Pearl Meyer &amp; Partners, LLC, as its independent compensation consultant.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on an evaluation of our peer group and the advice of Pearl Meyer, the Compensation Committee determined that the equity awards issued to our executive officers under our long-term equity award plan should be changed to a combination of time-based and performance-based equity awards.&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2016, the Compensation Committee issued time-based and performance-based equity awards to our executive officers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although these equity awards were granted during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 and are included in the compensation tables below, the Compensation Committee granted these equity awards as the long-term equity award component of the compensation our executive officers will receive for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Compensation Committee does not intend to grant any additional equity awards under our long-term incentive plan for fiscal 2017.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Specifically, the Special Committee or the Compensation Committee approved the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	following compensation&nbsp;during&nbsp;f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	iscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for our&nbsp;named
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	executive officers:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	John C. Pescatore, President and Chief Executive Officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	salary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	did not increase in Fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;In Fiscal 2015, his salary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	increased from $200,000 to $350,000 effective as of July&nbsp;1, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, Mr. Pescatore received $105,000 related to his target bonus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	which his
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	target bonus eligibility was set at 100% of his base salary, in connection with the June 2014 private placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	During Fiscal 2016, Mr. Pescatore received 19,373 restricted stock units that vest over four (4) years, with 25% vesting on January 13, 2017, and the remainder of the restricted units will vest in three equal annual installments thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Mr. Pescatore received 19,373 performance stock units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The performance stock units will vest in full upon attainment of the performance goals.&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance is based upon achievement, prior to January 13, 2020, of (A) a Final Order from the FCC providing for the creation and allocation of licenses for spectrum in the 900 MHz band consisting of paired blocks of contiguous spectrum, each containing at least 3 MHz of contiguous spectrum, authorized for broadband wireless communications uses and (B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the lack of objection by the Company's Board of Directors to the terms and conditions&nbsp;&nbsp;(including, but not limited to, the rebanding, clearing and relocation procedures, license assignment and award mechanisms, and technical and operational rules) set forth or referenced in the F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inal Order.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In Fiscal 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in connection with the June 2014 private placement, Mr.&nbsp;Pescatore was granted a stock option to purchase 300,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $20.00 per share. 25% of the option shares vested on June&nbsp;10, 2015, and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three equal annual installments thereafter.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Finally,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pursuant to the terms of the registration rights agreement we entered into with the investors who participated in the June&nbsp;2014&nbsp;private placement, Mr. Pescatore received a bonus from the Company in the amount of $35,000 (10% of his base salary during Fiscal 2015) because of the submission and filing of the registration statement that was declared
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	effective on January&nbsp;26, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Morgan E. O&#x2019;Brien, Vice Chairman
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien&#x2019;s salary was increased from $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	200,00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	0 to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	300,000 on April 1, 2015 and increased from $0 to $2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	00,000 effective as of June&nbsp;10, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, Mr. O&#x2019;Brien received $75,000 related to his target bonus which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	was set at 75% of his base salary in connection with the June 2014 private placement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	During Fiscal 2016, Mr. O&#x2019;Brien was granted a stock option to purchase 50,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $25.81 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;25% of the option shares will vest on January 13, 2017, and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three equal annual installments thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Mr. O&#x2019;Brien was granted a performance stock option to purchase 50,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $25.81 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;The option shares will vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in full upon attainment of the performance goals.&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance is based upon achievement, prior to January 13, 2020, of (A) a Final Order from the FCC providing for the creation and allocation of licenses for spectrum in the 900 MHz band consisting of paired blocks of contiguous spectrum, each containing at least 3 MHz of contiguous spectrum, authorized for broadband wireless communications uses and (B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the lack of objection by the Company's Board of Directors to the terms and conditions&nbsp;&nbsp;(including, but not limited to, the rebanding, clearing and relocation procedures, license assignment and award mechanisms, and technical and operational rules) set forth or referenced in the F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inal Order.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Additionally, in connection with the June 2014 private placement, he was granted a stock option to&nbsp;purchase&nbsp;135,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $20.00 per share. 25% of the option shares
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	vested
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	on June&nbsp;10, 2015, and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three equal annual installments thereafter. On January&nbsp;29, 2015, Mr.&nbsp;O&#x2019;Brien was granted a stock option to purchase 165,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $25.00 per share. 100,000 of the option shares vested upon grant, 25% of the remaining 65,000 option shares
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	vested
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	on January&nbsp;29, 2016 and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three annual installments thereafter. The grant&nbsp;was&nbsp;made to&nbsp;reflect Mr. O&#x2019;Brien joining the Company as an executive officer on a full-time basis in Fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Robert Schwartz, Chief Strategy and Development Officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mr. Schwartz&#x2019;s salary was increased from $0 to $250,000, effective as of August 3, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;His target bonus eligibility was set at 40% of his base salary upon his employment by the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, he was granted a stock option to purchase 70,000 shares of our common stock with and exercise price equal to $26.59 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;25% of the option shares will vest on August 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three equal installments thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr. Schwartz was also granted a stock option to purchase 30,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price equal to $24.45 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;25% of the option shares will vest on February 23, 2017, and the remainder of the option shares will vest in three equal installments thereafter.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	6

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.04%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	375,000&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.62%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	(3)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.76%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.04%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	32,552&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.76%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.04%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	175,000&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.62%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.76%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;">
	(5)

</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ever
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_SEVERANCEARRANGEMENTSWITHOURNEOS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ance Arrangements with our Named Executive Officers
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Severance Plan Participation Agreement
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	March&nbsp;2015, we entered into a Severance Plan Participation Agreement (the &#x201C;Participation Agreement&#x201D;) with&nbsp;each of&nbsp;our executive officers and certain key employees pursuant to our Executive Severance Plan (the &#x201C;Severance Plan&#x201D;) approved by our Compensation Committee. The Severance Plan establishes the amount of severance payments and benefits available in the event of a (i)&nbsp;termination of employment by the Company without Cause or by the participant for Good Reason and (ii)&nbsp;termination of employment by the Company without Cause or by the participant for Good Reason within&nbsp;six&nbsp;months before or within 24 months after a Change in Control (as defined in the Severance Plan).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	54
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Severance Plan establishes three tiers of executives: Tier 1, Tier 2 and Tier 3. The Company&#x2019;s Tier 1 executives are: Brian D. McAuley, Chairman of the Board; Morgan E. O&#x2019;Brien, Vice Chairman of the Board; John C. Pescatore, President and Chief Executive Officer; and Tim Gray, Chief Financial Officer. The Company&#x2019;s Tier 2 executives are: Frank Creede, Chief Technical Officer; Leon Frazier, Chief Sales and Marketing Officer; Richard Rohmann, Executive Vice President; Thomas Sidman, Chief Legal Officer, Robert Schwartz, Chief Strategy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and Development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Officer; Steven J. Schreiber, Vice President &#x2013; Business Operations; and Laura Politi, Vice President &#x2013; Human Resources. There are no Tier 3 executives at this time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Upon termination of employment by the Company without Cause or by the participant for Good Reason, each (i)&nbsp;Tier 1 executive is eligible for a cash severance payment equal to 2.0 times the sum of the executive&#x2019;s base salary plus target bonus, paid in installments over 24 months, plus a pro-rated target bonus for the fiscal year in which the termination occurs and (ii)&nbsp;Tier 2 executive is eligible for a cash severance payment equal to 1.5 times the sum of the executive&#x2019;s base salary plus target bonus, paid in installments over 18 months, plus a pro-rated target bonus for the fiscal year in which the termination occurs. Additionally, for equity awards granted prior to February&nbsp;18, 2015 (the &#x201C;Effective Date&#x201D;), each Tier 1 and Tier 2 executive will receive full accelerated vesting of such equity awards and a 2-year time period to exercise any stock options included in such equity awards. For equity awards granted after the Effective Date, each Tier 1 and Tier 2 executive will receive pro-rated accelerated vesting of such equity awards and a 9-month time period to exercise any stock options included in such equity awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Upon termination of employment by the Company without Cause or by the executive for Good Reason within 6 months before or within 24 months after a Change in Control (as defined in the Severance Plan), each (i)&nbsp;Tier 1 executive is eligible for a cash severance payment equal to 2.0 times the sum of the executive&#x2019;s base salary plus target bonus, paid in a lump sum, plus a pro-rated target bonus for the fiscal year in which the termination occurs and (ii)&nbsp;Tier 2 executive is eligible for a cash severance payment equal to 1.5 times the sum of the executive&#x2019;s base salary plus target bonus, paid in a lump sum, plus a pro-rated target bonus for the fiscal year in which the termination occurs. In addition, each Tier 1 and Tier 2 executive will receive full accelerated vesting of all outstanding equity grants and a 2-year time period to exercise any stock options included in such equity awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Severance Plan also provides for payment of health benefits continuation for a maximum of 18 months and outplacement services for a maximum of 12 months and $25,000 for Tier 1 and Tier 2 executives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Any future Tier 3 executives will be eligible for cash severance, equity acceleration and health benefits in an amount to be determined by the Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Further, pursuant to the terms of the Severance Plan Participation Agreements, any existing employment or severance agreement between the Company and the participant&nbsp;was immediately terminated and replaced with the provisions of the Severance Plan, subject to limited exceptions required to comply with the requirements of Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A. As of the Effective Date, the Company had employment agreements with its President and Chief Executive Officer, John C. Pescatore,&nbsp;its Chief Technical Officer, Frank Creede, and its Executive Vice President and Secretary, Richard Rohmann. Each Severance Plan Participation Agreement also provides that any equity award agreements held by a participant as of the Effective Date are amended to provide that the terms &#x201C;Cause,&#x201D; &#x201C;Change in Control,&#x201D; &#x201C;Disability&#x201D; and &#x201C;Good Reason&#x201D; as defined in the Severance Plan shall govern the outstanding equity award agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201C;Cause&#x201D; as defined in the Severance Plan means (i)&nbsp;the willful and continued failure of the participant to perform substantially the participant&#x2019;s duties with the Company (other than any such failure resulting from incapacity due to physical or mental illness), as determined by the Board of Directors with respect to any Tier 1 executive and as determined by the Company&#x2019;s Chief Executive Officer with respect to any Tier 2 or 3 executive no earlier than 30 days after a written demand for substantial performance is delivered to the participant, which specifically identifies the manner in which the Company believes that the participant has willfully and continuously failed to perform substantially the participant&#x2019;s duties with the Company (provided, however, that with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	respect to any Tier&nbsp;1 executive, the failure to achieve individual or Company-based performance goals, budgets or targets shall not be deemed to be a failure of the participant to perform his or her duties for purposes of this definition of Cause); (ii)&nbsp;the willful engaging by the participant in illegal conduct or gross misconduct which is materially and demonstrably injurious to the Company or participant&#x2019;s ability to perform his or her duties with the Company; (iii)&nbsp;conviction (including a plea of guilty or&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	no lo contendere
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	) of a felony; or (iv)&nbsp;a material breach of the restrictive covenants in Section&nbsp;6(b) of the Severance Plan subject to the cure provisions provided in Section&nbsp;6(b) of the Severance Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201C;Good Reason&#x201D; as defined in the Severance Plan means, without the participant&#x2019;s consent, (i)&nbsp;a material diminution in the participant&#x2019;s base salary, other than a material diminution that results from a determination by both the President/CEO and the Chairman that the Company&#x2019;s financial condition is such that a reduction in compensation is appropriate and the reduction is applied uniformly to all Company officers; (ii)&nbsp;a material diminution in the participant&#x2019;s authority, duties, or responsibilities, which shall include (A)&nbsp;with respect to any participant who is a member of the Board of Directors, any failure of the Board of Directors to appoint or the stockholders of the Company to elect such participant as a member of the Board of Directors, or any removal of participant from the Board of Directors for reasons other than Cause, and (B)&nbsp;with respect to any participant who is a Tier 1 executive, following a Change in Control, a material change in the Company&#x2019;s long-term business plan or its strategy to increase the value of its FCC licenses; or (iii)&nbsp;any requirement that the participant relocate, by more than 50 miles, the principal location from which the participant performs services for the Company immediately prior to the termination of employment or the occurrence of the Change in Control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Em
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_EMPLOYEEBENEFITPLANS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ployee Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014 Stock Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our 2014 Stock Plan was adopted by our Board of Directors on May&nbsp;12, 2014 and approved by our stockholde
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	rs on&nbsp;May&nbsp;30, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Initially, 1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	200,000 shares of our common stock were authorized and reserved for issuance under our 2014 Stock Plan. This
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	reserve automatically increases on January 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	st
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	each year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	through January&nbsp;1, 2024 by an amount equal to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	lessor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5% of the number of shares of common stock issued and outstanding on the immediately preceding December&nbsp;31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	st
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a lesser amount determined by our Board of Directors. Accordingly,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	623,651 shares of common stock were added to our 2014 Stock Plan on January 1, 2015 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	714,583
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	shares of common stock were added on January&nbsp;1, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and were made available for future issuance under the 2014 Stock Plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As a result, an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2,538,234
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	shares have been authorized and reserved for issuance under our 2014 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Appropriate adjustments will be made in the number of authorized shares and other numerical limits in our 2014 Stock Plan and in outstanding awards to prevent dilution or enlargement of participants&#x2019; rights in the event of a stock split or other change in our capital structure. Shares subject to awards granted under our 2014 Stock Plan which expire, are repurchased or are cancelled or forfeited will again become available for issuance under our 2014 Stock Plan. The shares available will not be reduced by awards settled in cash. Shares withheld to satisfy tax withholding obligations will not again become available for grant. The gross number of shares issued upon the exercise of stock appreciation rights or options exercised by means of a net exercise or by tender of previously owned shares will be deducted from the shares available under our 2014 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Awards may be granted under our 2014 Stock Plan to our employees, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	officers, directors or consultants, and our present or future affiliated entities. While we may grant incentive stock options only to employees, we may grant nonstatutory stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock purchase rights or bonuses, restricted stock units, performance shares, performance units and cash-based awards or other stock-based awards to any eligible participant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The 2014 Stock Plan is administered by our Compensation Committee. Subject to the provisions of our 2014 Stock Plan, the Compensation Committee determines, in its discretion, the persons to whom, and the times at which, awards are granted, as well as the size, terms and conditions of each award. All awards are evidenced by a written agreement between us and the holder of the award. The Compensation Committee has the authority to construe and interpret the terms of our 2014 Stock Plan and awards granted under our 2014 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Except to the extent different treatment is provided for pursuant to the terms of our Severance Plan, in the event of a change in control as described in our 2014 Stock Plan, our Compensation Committee may provide generally for one of three effects on awards:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Accelerated vesting: in its discretion, our Compensation Committee may provide for acceleration of the exercisability, vesting and/or settlement in connection with a change in control of each or any outstanding award or portion thereof and shares
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	acquired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pursuant thereto.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Assumption, continuation or substitution: the acquirer may, without the consent of any awardee, assume or continue our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	awarded certain directors and employees of the company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	options to purchase 274,000 shares of our common stock with exercises prices of $24.45 to $49.16 with 25% of the option shares vesting on the first anniversary of the applicable grant date and there remainder of the option shares vesting in three equal annual installments thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	performance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	options to purchase 50,000 shares of our common stock with an exercise price of $25.81 with the option shares vesting once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the performance criteria
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	attained.&nbsp;&nbsp;We issued 140,722 restricted stock awards and 37,295 of performance stock units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	From May&nbsp;14, 2014 through March&nbsp;31, 2015, we awarded certain&nbsp;directors,&nbsp;employees and contractors of the Company options to purchase 1,390,957 shares of our common stock under our 2014 Stock Plan with exercise prices of $20.00 to $46.23 per share with 25% of the option shares vesting on the first anniversary of the applicable grant date and the remainder of the option shares vesting in three equal annual installments thereafter. We also issued a grant of 1,750 restricted stock units during the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	2010 Stock Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our 2010 Stock Plan was adopted by our Board of Directors and approved by our stockholders. Under the 2010 Stock Plan, there were 49,505 stock options and 126,251 restricted stock units outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;We do not&nbsp;currently&nbsp;intend to grant any additional awards under our 2010 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	2004 Stock Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our&nbsp;2004&nbsp;Stock Plan was adopted by our Board of Directors and approved by our stockholders. Under the 2004 Plan, there were options to purchase 8,336&nbsp;shares of our common stock that are vested and outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2015.&nbsp;Our 2004 Stock Plan terminated by its terms, and as a result, no further awards will be issued&nbsp;under our 2004 Stock Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

	401(k)&nbsp;Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.

	lan does not provide for matching contributions by the Company.

<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	DIRE
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_DIRECTORCOMPENSATION">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	CTOR COMPENSATION
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our directors play a critical role in guiding our strategic direction and overseeing the management of our Company. Ongoing developments in corporate governance and financial reporting have resulted in an increased demand for highly qualified and productive public company directors. The varied responsibilities, the substantial time commitment and the potential risks of serving as a director for a public company require that we provide adequate compensation for the continued performance of our non-employee directors by offering them compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;that is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	commensurate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	with the workload and the demands we place on them. Our non-employee directors are compensated based upon their Board and Board Committee responsibilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Messrs. McAuley, O&#x2019;Brien and Pescatore, who are each executive officers of the Company, receive no separate compensation for their service as directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our director compensation is overseen by the Compensation Committee, which makes recommendations to our Board of Directors on the appropriate structure for our non-employee director compensation program and the appropriate amount of compensation to offer to our non-employee directors. Our Board of Directors is responsible for final approval of our non-employee director compensation program and the compensation paid to our non-employee directors.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, the Compensation Committee retained Pearl Meyer &amp; Partners, LLC as its independent compensation consultant to assess the Company&#x2019;s non-employee director compensation program. With the assistance of Pearl Meyer, the Compensation Committee and Board of Directors established the Company&#x2019;s philosophy to target total compensation for our non-employee directors at the 50th percentile of the market, based on the same peer group used in benchmarking the compensation of our executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	N
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	on-Employee Director Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table summarizes information concerning the compensation awarded to, earned by, or paid for services rendered in all capacities by our non-employee directors during Fiscal 2016 (the period ended March 31, 2016).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Narr
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_NARRATIVEDISCUSSIONOFTHEDIRECTORCOMPENSA">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	ative Discussion of the Director Compensation Table
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For the fiscal year ended March 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and for the period from April 1, 2015 through September 30, 2015, our non-employee director compensation program consisted of: (i) annual cash retainers for Board service and for service as the chair of one of the standing Board Committees; (ii) meeting fees for attendance at Board Meetings; and (iii) long-term equity awards consisting of fully-vested stock option awards granted on an annual basis to continuing non-employee directors immediately following the annual meeting of stockholders.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on an analysis of the Company&#x2019;s peer group and the advice provided by Pearl Meyer, the Compensation Committee and Board determined to increase the size of the annual retainers offered to our non-employee directors for their Board service and for their service as the chair of one of the standing Board Committees so that the annual retainers we offer to our non-employee directors would be within the 50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	percentile of the annual retainers offered by the companies in our peer group.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the same time, the Compensation Committee and Board determined to eliminate Board meeting fees.&nbsp;&nbsp;The changes to the annual retainers and the elimination of the Board meeting fees were effective as of October 1, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Compensation Committee and Board also determined, based on an evaluation of our peer group and the advice of Pearl Meyer, to change the long-term equity awards we offer to our non-employee directors from fully-vested stock options to restricted stock awards.&nbsp;&nbsp;This change in the long-term equity awards we offer to our non-employee directors will be effective for the awards issued to our non-employee directors immediately following our 2016 annual meeting of stockholders.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our non-employee directors received stock option awards following the 2015 annual meeting of stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Annual Cash Retainers:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For the period from April 1, 2015 through September 30, 2015, o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ur non-employee directors receive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the following annual cash retainers:&nbsp;&nbsp;$25,000 for service on the Board, $10,000 for service as the Audit Committee chair, $5,000 for service as the Compensation Committee chair, and $5,000 for service as the Nominating and&nbsp;Corporate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Governance Committee chair.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	These annual retainers were paid in 4 equal quarterly installments, payable on the first day of each new calendar quarter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Commencing on October 1, 2015, our non-employee directors will receive the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	following annual cash retainers:&nbsp;&nbsp;$5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,000 for service on the Board, $1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,000 for service as the Audit Committee chair, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,000 for service as the Compensation Committee chair, and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,000 for service as the Nominating and&nbsp;Corporate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Governance Committee chair.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	These annual retainers will be paid in 4 equal quarterly installments, payable on the first day of each new calendar quarter commencing on October 1, 2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Meeting Fees:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For the period from April 1, 2015 through September 30, 2015, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	non-employee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	receive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a fee of $1,000 for each Board meeting they attend in person or participate in by telephone.&nbsp;&nbsp;No meeting fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	paid to our non-employee directors for their attendance or participation in&nbsp;committee&nbsp;meetings.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;Commencing on October 1, 2015, no further meeting fees will be paid to our non-employee directors for their attendance at Board or Board Committee meetings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	d

	These stock awards were granted on November 4, 2015, immediately following the 2015 annual meeting of stockholders.

	our 2016 annual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	meeting of stockholders will receive a grant of restricted stock on the date of such annual meeting with a grant date fair market value equal to approximately $65,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each such annual award will vest on the earlier of (i) immediately prior to the commencement of the next regularly scheduled annual meeting of stockholders or (ii) 12 months from the grant date, subject to accelerated vesting in the event of (x) a change of control of the Company or (y) the director&#x2019;s death, resignation or removal from the Board without cause.&nbsp;

	The following table sets forth information about the beneficial ownership of our common stock by (i)&nbsp;each of our directors, (ii)&nbsp;each of our named executive officers named in the Summary Compensation Table under &#x201C;Executive Compensation,&#x201D; (iii)&nbsp;all our directors and executive officers as a group, and (iv)&nbsp;each person or group known by us to own more than 5% of our common stock. The percentages reflect beneficial ownership, as determined in accordance with the SEC&#x2019;s rules, as of May&nbsp;12, 2016 and are based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	14,300,790
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	shares of common stock outstanding as of May&nbsp;12, 2016. Except as noted below, the address for all beneficial owners in the table below is 3&nbsp;Garret Mountain Plaza, Suite 401, Woodland Park, New Jersey 07424.

	&nbsp;

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	We determined the number of shares of common stock beneficially owned by each person under rules promulgated by the SEC, based on information obtained from Company records and filings with the SEC. In calculating the number of shares beneficially owned by an individual or entity and the percentage ownership of that individual or entity, shares underlying options, warrants or restricted stock units held by that individual or entity that are either currently exercisable or exercisable within 60 days from May&nbsp;12, 2016 are deemed outstanding. These shares, however, are not deemed outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of any other individual or entity. Unless otherwise indicated and subject to community property laws where applicable, the individuals and entities named in the table above have sole voting and investment power with respect to all shares of our common stock shown as beneficially owned by them.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

Each of Great American Life Insurance Company and Great American Insurance Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Financial Group, Inc. The&nbsp;board of&nbsp;directors of American Financial Group, Inc. consists of Carl&nbsp;H. Linder III, S. Craig Linder, Kenneth C. Ambrecht, John B. Berding, Joseph E. Consolino, Virginia&nbsp;C. Drosos, James E. Evans, Terry S. Jacobs, Gregory G. Joseph, William W. Verity and John Von Lehman who exercise voting and investment control over the shares held by the stockholder. The address for Great American is 301 East 4th Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, requires our executive officers and directors and persons who beneficially own more than 10% of our common stock to file initial reports of beneficial ownership and reports of changes in beneficial ownership with the SEC. Such persons are required by SEC regulations to furnish us with copies of all Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;forms filed by such persons. Based solely on a review of copies of reports provided to the Company pursuant to Rule&nbsp;16a-3(e) of the Exchange Act and representations of such reporting persons, the Company believes that during Fiscal 2016, such SEC filing requirements were satisfied.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	IT
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_CERTAINRELATIONSHIPS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	EM&nbsp;13. CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS, RELATED TRANSACTIONS AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have not engaged in any related party transaction since April&nbsp;1, 2015 in which the amount involved exceeds $120,000 and in which any of our directors,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	named executive officers or any holder of more than 5% of our common stock, or any member of the immediate family of any of these persons or entities controlled by any of them, had or will have a direct or indirect material interest, other than the compensation arrangements described in &#x201C;Executive Compensation&#x201D; and the transactions set forth below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	May 2015 Registered Follow-On Offering
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In May 2015, we completed a registered follow-on public offering of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	shares of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	common stock resulting in the sale of 1,725,000&nbsp;shares at a purchase price of $40.00 per share, which included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	225,000 shares sold pursuant to the underwriters&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	exercise of their over-allotment option. Net proceeds were approximately $64.8 million after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions, and estimated offering expenses. Three of our holders who held more than 5% of our outstanding common stock, Cerberus Capital Management, L.P., Owl Creek Asset Management, L.P. and American Financial Group, Inc. (Great American), purchased 500,000 shares, 110,000 shares and 62,500 shares, respectively, of our common stock in the follow-on offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Additionally, we have entered into indemnification agreements with our officers and directors. These agreements will require us to indemnify these individuals to the fullest extent permitted under Delaware law against liabilities that may arise by reason of their service to us, and to advance expenses incurred as a result of any proceeding against them as to which they could be indemnified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Related Party Transaction Policy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Pursuant to our code of business conduct and ethics, our executive officers, directors, and principal stockholders, including their immediate family members and affiliates, will be prohibited from entering into a related party transaction with us witho
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ut the prior approval of our A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee or our independent directors. Any request for us to enter into a transaction with an executive officer, director, principal stockholder, or any of such persons&#x2019; immediate family members or affiliates, in which the amount involved exceeds $120,000, must first be presented to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee for review, consideration and approval. In approving or rejecting the proposed agreement, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee will consider the relevant facts and circumstances available and deemed relevant, including, but not limited, to the risks, costs and benefits to us, the terms of the transaction, the availability of other sources for comparable services or products, and, if applicable, the impact on a director&#x2019;s independence. Our Audit Committee shall approve only those agreements that, in light of known circumstances, are in, or are not inconsistent with, our best interests, as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	udit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ommittee determines in the good faith exercise of its discretion.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&#xFEFF;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit Fees.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit fees consist of fees billed for the audit of our annual consolidated financial statements, the review of the interim consolidated financial statements, and related services that are normally provided in connection with registration statements, including the registration statements for our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	May 2015 follow-on offering,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	June 2014 and January 2015 private placements, along with our initial public offering.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Included in Fiscal 2016 is $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	59
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	0 of fees billed in connection with our follow-on offering.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Included in the fiscal year 2015 audit fees is $115,750 of fees billed in connection with our private placements and initial public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Audit-Related Fees.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;There were no such fees incurred in Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose signature appears below constitutes and appoints John
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Pescatore and Timothy Gray, and each of them individually, as the undersigned&#x2019;s true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents, with full power of substitution and resubstitution, for the undersigned and in the undersigned&#x2019;s name, place, and stead, in any and all capacities, to sign any and all amendments to this Report, and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto, and other documents in connection therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, granting unto said attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them, full power and authority to do and perform each and every act and thing requisite and necessary to be done in connection therewith, as fully to all intents and purposes as the undersigned might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming that all said attorneys-in-fact and agents, or any of them or their respective substitute or substitutes, may lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Re
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_REPORT">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	port of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	The Board of Directors and Stockholders of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	pdvWireless, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have audited the accompanying
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	balance sheets of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	dvWireless, Inc. as of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6 and 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and the related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	statements of operations, stockholders&#x2019; equity/(deficiency), and cash flows for each of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	three years ended March 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are the responsibility of the C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany&#x2019;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements are free of material misstatement. We were not engaged to perform an audit of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting. Our audits include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also includes examining on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	financial position of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	dvWireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, Inc. as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years ended March 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/s/ PKF O&#x2019;Connor Davies, LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	New York, New York
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 13, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
