<A NAME="eolPage78"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	dvWireless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<A NAME="PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_NOTES">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tes to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	1.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Nature of Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pdvWireless, Inc. (formerly known as Pacific DataVision, Inc., the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is a private wireless communications carrier and provider of mobile workforce communication and location based solutions focused on increasing the productivity of its customers&#x2019; field-based workers and the efficiency of their dispatch and call center operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company commenced launching private push-to-talk (&#x201C;PTT&#x201D;) networks in major markets throughout the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Its proprietary and industry-validated suite of mobile communications and workforce management applications improve team communication and field documentation across a wide array of industries, including transportation, distribution, construction, hospitality, waste management and field services.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the same time, the Company is pursuing a number of broadband spectrum opportunities and initiatives, including but not limited to, a Federal Communications Commission (&#x201C;FCC&#x201D;) regulatory process aimed at the realignment of its spectrum to be able to deploy broadband technologies to enterprises.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was originally incorporated in California in 1997, and reincorporated in Delaware in 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In November 2015, the Company changed its name from Pacific DataVision, Inc. to pdvWireless, Inc.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mpany maintains offices in Woodland Park, New Jersey, Reston, Virg
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inia and San Diego, California.&nbsp;&nbsp;It also maintains a sales office in West Conshohocken, Pennsylvania.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company is currently deploying and operating dedicated, wide-area, two-way radio networks that offer PTT communications services to primarily dispatch-centric, small and medium-sized businesses.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, the Company commercially launched its PTT service, which it markets as DispatchPlus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, in the greater, Houston, Texas metropolitan area.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company commenced service in six additional major metropolitan markets during fiscal 2016, including:&nbsp;&nbsp;Dallas, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Chicago, the greater New York area and Baltimore/Washington.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company offers its DispatchPlus communications solutions, which combines pdvConnect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2122;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, its proprietary suite of mobile communication and workforce management applications with state-of-the-art digital network architecture and mobile devices supplied by Motorola Solutions, Inc. and its subsidiaries (&#x201C;Motorola&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Developed for dispatch-centric businesses, pdvConnect is an easy to use and efficient mobile communication and workforce management solutions that enables businesses to locate and communicate with their field workers and improve the documentation of work events and job status.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also built with the commercial dispatch user in mind, Motorola&#x2019;s digital network architecture allows the Company to provide highly reliable, instant and wide-area PTT communication services to its customers.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company expects that its DispatchPlus business will become its principal near term operating business.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, the Company has not yet generated significant revenues fro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	m its DispatchPlus business.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company primarily markets its DispatchPlus service to customers indirectly through third-party dealers selected from Motorola&#x2019;s nationwide dealer network and other select wireless dealers.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company supports its indirect sales representatives by providing them with training, marketing and advertising support f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rom
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its internal sales and marketing team.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company enters into contracts directly with end users of its DispatchPlus communication solutions, including those introduced to it through its indirect dealer network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Concurrently with launching its DispatchPlus business, the Company is pursuing initiatives to increase the efficiency and capacity of its spectrum licenses, including filing (together with the Enterprise Wireless Alliance) a Joint Petition for Rulemaking with the FCC proposing a realignment of a portion of the 900
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	MHz spectrum from narrowband to broadband.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has responded to all requests for information from the FCC and other interested parties, and it is currently awaiting FCC action.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FCC&#x2019;s action may take a number of forms ranging from:&nbsp;&nbsp;a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking, to a Notice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inquiry, to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	dismissal of the Joint Petition without further action
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;To its knowledge, the FCC has not reached a decision on the Joint Petition. The Company currently believes that the most likely outcome is that the FCC will adopt a Notice of Inquiry as the next step in the process.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has no information, however, on the content
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	scope of a potential Notice of Inquiry.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry is a vehicle for the FCC to gather additional information for the record.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the FCC elects to adopt a Notice of Inquiry, it could request
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional information and input on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	optimal use of the 900 MHz band generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Notice of Inquiry could also request information on the specific
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	issues and proposed solutions raised by us and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	commentators in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	proceeding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The adoption of a Notice of Inquiry does not mean that the FCC has denied its Joint Petition, or that the Joint Petition will not ultimately result in a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	continues to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	believe in the merits of its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	proposal,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Joint Petition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is consistent with the FCC&#x2019;s past practices and policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nevertheless
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, obtaining a favorable result from the FCC may take a significant amount of time and resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Moreover, there is no assurance that the FCC will adopt the proposed rules, or ultimately approve the Company&#x2019;s Joint Petition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition to this regulatory action, the Company is also pursuing a number of broadband and additional spectrum and wireless service opportunities,&nbsp;&nbsp;including acquiring additional spectrum to support its realignment efforts and the deployment of a future broadband network, attempting to build consensus with incumbents in the 900 MHz band, developing a strategic plan for its future deployment of a broadband or other wireless services in the 900 MHz band, and evaluating whether existing technologies and equipment can be used to support
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spectrum initiatives and opportunities.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to its opportunities in the 900 MHz band, the Company is pursuing additional spectrum and related wireless service opportunities. The potential opportunities it has been exploring include several surrounding the First Responder Network Authority (&#x201C;FirstNet&#x201D;), which involves government plans and a related process to provide a substantial amount of funding for the build-out and operation of a dedicated Nationwide Public Safety Broadband Network (&#x201C;NPSBN&#x201D;) that also may be used, on a non-priority, excess capacity basis, to meet the wireless service needs of a variety of commercial customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no assurance, however, that the Company will be successful in its pursuit of spectrum opportunities related to FirstNet or any other spectrum opportunities that it identifies and attempts to pursue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Prior to acquiring its 900 MHz spectrum, the Company wa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s engaged in the development and sale of its wireless communications applications, marketed primarily under the name pdvConnect. The Company primarily offers these applications indirectly to the end users of two Tier I wireless communications carriers in the United States and, until July 2015, one international wireless communications carrier under licensing agreements between the Company and these carriers. The Company also offers these applications directly to end users.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement with certain wholly-owned subsidiaries of Sprint Corporation (the &#x201C;Sprint APA&#x201D;) to purchase nationwide spectrum in the 900 MHz band for a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$100.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$90.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million paid in cash from the proceeds of the private placement the Company completed in June 2014 (the &#x201C;June 2014 Private Placement&#x201D;) (see below) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$10.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million paid in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of common stock (at a price equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$20.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Completed the June 2014 Private Placement, on June&nbsp;10, 2014, in which the Company sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10,925,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of common stock at a purchase price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share. The net proceeds from the June 2014 Private Placement after deducting expenses including professional fees and the payment of initial placement fees, were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$202
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million. Approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	96%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the net proceeds, or approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$196
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million (net of any initial purchaser&#x2019;s /placement agent&#x2019;s discount and placement fees), were held in trust until the closing of the Sprint APA. The parties closed the Sprint APA in September 2014 upon receipt of the necessary approvals from the FCC.
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$1,016,956
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, to provide that the Redeemable Notes would automatically be converted at the closing of the Sprint APA into that number of shares of common stock equal to the sum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	140%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of the principal plus the outstanding interest on such Redeemable Notes through the conversion divided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$20.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	per share;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. The purpose of this private placement was to secure additional round lot stockholders to enable the

	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Basis of Presentation and Use of Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	financial statements and accompanying notes are prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&#x201C;US GAAP&#x201D;), which require management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. The most significant estimates relate to estimated useful lives of depreciable assets,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	asset retirement obligations,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the carrying amount of long-lived assets under construction in process,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	valuation allowance on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompany&#x2019;s deferred tax assets, and recoverability of intangible assets. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompany is also required to make certain estimates with regard to the valuation of awards and forfeiture rates for its share-based award programs. Estimates and assumptions are reviewed periodically and the effects of revision are reflected in the financial statements in the period they are deemed to be necessary. Accordingly actual results could differ from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ompany and its subsidiar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	PDV Spectrum Holding Company, LLC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	formed in April 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Reclassifications
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Certain prior year amounts have been reclassified to conform to the financial statements for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	financial statement presentation. These reclassifications had no effect on previously reported results of operations, cash flows, assets, liabilities or equity for the years presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Cash and Cash E
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	quivalents
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	All highly liquid investments with maturities of three months or less of the time of purchase are considered cash equivalents. Cash equivalents are stated at cost, which approximates quoted market value and include amounts held in money market funds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage81"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Allowance for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Doubtful Accounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	An allowance for uncollectible receivables is estimated based on a combination of write-off history, aging analysis and any specifi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	c known troubled accounts. The C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany reviews its allowance for uncollectible receivables on a quarterly basis. Past due balances meeting specific criteria are reviewed individually for collectability. At March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, management provided an allowance of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2,633
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7,977
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively, for certain slow paying accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:13.5PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inventory
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventories, which consist
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	vehicle-mounted devices
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and handsets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, are valued at the lower of cost or market, with market being defined as replacement value using the First In, First Out method.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Provisions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	made periodically to reduce any excess, obsolete or slow moving inventory to its net realizable value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Property and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Property and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	equipment is stated at cost. Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shorter of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	estimated useful lives of the assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or the applicable lease term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The carrying amount at the balance sheet date of long-lived assets under construction in process include construction costs to date on capital projects that have not been completed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	assets being constructed that are not ready to be placed into service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and assets that are not currently in service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These costs will be transferred to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	property
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and equipment when substantially all of the activities necessary to prepare the assets for their intended use are completed. Depreciation commences upon completion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting for Asset Retirement Obligations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	An asset retirement obligation is evaluated and recorded as appropriate on assets for which the Company has a legal obligation to retire. The Company records a liability for an asset retirement obligation and the associated asset retirement cost at the time the underlying asset is acquired and put into service. Subsequent to the initial measurement of the asset retirement obligation, the obligation is adjusted at the end of each period to reflect the passage of time and changes in the estimated future cash flows underlying the obligation, if any.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company enters into long-term leasing arrangements primarily for tower site
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	location
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s. The Company constructs assets at these locations and, in accordance with the terms of many of these agreements, the Company is obligated to restore the premises to their original condition at the conclusion of the agreements, generally at the demand of the other party to these agreements. The Company recognizes the fair value of a liability for an asset retirement obligation and capitalizes that cost as part of the cost basis of the related asset, depreciating it over the useful life of the related asset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of March 31, 2016, the Company had an asset retirement obligation of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	203,546
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets are wireless licenses that will be used to provide the exclusive right to utilize designated radio frequency spectrum to provide wireless communication services. While licenses are issued for only a fixed time, generally ten years, such licenses are subject to renewal by the F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	CC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. License renewals have occurred routinely and at nominal cost. There are currently no legal, regulatory, contractual, competitive, economic or other factors that limit the useful life of the company&#x2019;s wireless licenses. As a result, the wireless licenses are treated as an indefini
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	te-lived intangible asset. The C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany evaluates the useful life determination for wireless licenses each year to determine whether events and circumstances continue to support an indefinite useful life.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The licenses are tested for impairment on an aggregate basis, as the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany will be utilizing the wireless licenses on an integrated basis as a part of developing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nationwide network. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	considers estimates of valuation methods to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	perform the test of the fair values of wireless licenses annually
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including market based and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	discounted cash flow approach
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	es
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Patent Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Costs to acquire a patent on certain aspects of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany&#x2019;s technology have been capitalized. These amounts are amortized, subject to periodic evaluation for impairment, over statutory lives following award of the patent. Gross patent cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$570,99
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at March&nbsp;31, 2016 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$558,696
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at March&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the associated accumulated amortization amounted to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	48
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	634
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	37,914
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively. Amortization expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10,720
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	34,609
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and

	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	42,830
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>

	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per year over the next
</FONT>

	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year period.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Renewal costs are expensed when incurred.

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-Lived Asset Impairment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany evaluates long-lived assets, other than intangible assets with indefinite lives, for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset group may not be recoverable. Asset groups are determined at the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of cash flows of other groups of assets and liabilities. When the carrying amount of a long-lived asset group is not recoverable and exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss is recognized equal to the excess of the asset group&#x2019;s carrying value over the estimated fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Financial instruments, including cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, accounts receivable, accounts payable,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	accrued expenses are carried at cost, which management believes approximates fair value because of the short term maturity of these instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes revenue in the period that persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery of the product has occurred or services have been rendered, it is able to determine the amount of revenue and when the collection of such amount is considered probable.&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with the guidance provided in Accounting Standards Codification (&#x201C;ASC&#x201D;) Topic 605-45-45, Revenue Recognition &#x2013; Principal Agent Considerations, the Company has determined that it is the primary obligor with respect to the service revenue derived from sales of the Company&#x2019;s software applications through its Tier I domestic carrier partners. As a result, revenue is recorded at the gross amount billed to end-user customers for sales through these carrier partners. The Company recognized service revenue for its international carrier (which business relationship terminated in July 2015) on the net amount billed since it has determined that it is not the primary obligor. The Company also sells service and applications directly to end-users, which are billed and collected directly by the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In September 2014, Motorola paid the Company an upfront, fully-paid leasing fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$7.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in order to lease a portion of the Company&#x2019;s wireless spectrum licenses. The payment of the fee is accounted for as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eferred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	evenue on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets. The Company recognizes leasing revenue in accordance with ASC Topic 840, Leases. The fee is amortized using the straight-line method over the lease term of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years, which represents the time period in which the benefits of the leased property are expected to be depleted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company evaluates certain transactions for its DispatchPlus service offering to determine whether they should be viewed as a Multiple Element Arrangement provided in ASC Topic 605-25.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Judgment is required to properly identify the accounting units of the multiple deliverable transactions and to determine the manner in which revenue should be allocated among the units of accounting.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Multiple deliverable arrangements are presumed to be bundled transactions, and the total consideration is measured and allocated to the separate transactions based on their relative selling price with certain limitations.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;The relative selling price for each deliverable is determined using vendor-specific objective evidence (&#x201C;V
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SOE&#x201D;) of selling price or third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party evidence of selling price if VSOE does not exist.&nbsp;&nbsp;If neither VSOE nor third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	party evidence of selling price exist, the Company uses its best estimate of the selling price for the deliverable.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has determined that the rental of user devices in connection with service contracts for its DispatchPlus service a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	re multiple deliverable arrangements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cost of Revenue
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s cost of revenue relating to sales of its software applications through its wireless carrier partners includes the portion of service revenue retained by its domestic carrier partners pursuant to its agreements with these parties, which may include network services, connectivity, SMS service, sales, marketing, billing and other ancillary services. With respect to its recently launched DispatchPlus service offering, the Company&#x2019;s cost of revenue includes the costs of operating its dispatch network, and its cloud-based solutions and to a lesser degree, the costs associated with the sales of the relevant user devices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Shipping and Handling Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Costs associated to shipping and handling of two-way radios to dealers or end-user customers are recognized as incurred and included in cost of revenue in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	onsolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tatements of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	perations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Indirect Sales Commissions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Cash consideration given to a dealer is presumed to be a reduction of revenue unless the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany receives, or will receive, an identifiable benefit in exchange for the consideration, and the fair value of such benefit can be reasonably estimated, in which case the consideration will be reco
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	rded as a selling expense. The C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compensates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its indirect sales representatives with an upfront commission and residual fees based on a customer&#x2019;s continued use of its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DispatchPlus s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ervice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. When a commission is earned solely due to the se
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lling activity relating to the C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	DispatchPlus service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the cost is recorded as a selling expense.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company reviews and records the e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stimated incentives payable to the indirect sales representatives
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as accrued expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	on a monthly basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Product Development Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany charges all product and development costs to expense as incurred. Types of expense incurred in product and development include employee compensation, consulting, travel, facility costs and equipment and technology costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Advertising and Promotional Expense
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany expenses advertising and promotional costs as incurred. Cooperative advertising reimbursements from vendors are recorded net of advertising and promotional expense in the period in which the related advertising and promotional expense is incurred.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Advertising and promotional expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$161,257
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the year ended March 31, 2016.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	advertising costs were incurred in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company accounts for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	restricted stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	restricted stock units,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	performance units, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stock options in accordance with US&nbsp;GAAP, which requires the measurement and recognition of compensation expense, based on the estimated fair value of awards granted to employees and directors. The Company estimates the fair value of share-based awards on the date of grant using an option-pricing model. The value of the portion of the award that is ultimately expected to vest is recognized as expense in the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Statements of O
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	perations over the requisite service periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event the participant&#x2019;s employment by or engagement with (as a director or otherwise) the Company terminates before exercise of the options granted, the stock options granted to the participant shall immediately expire and all rights to purchase shares thereunder shall immediately cease and expire and be of no further force or effect, other than applicable exercise rights for vested shares that may extend past the termination date as provided for in the participant&#x2019;s applicable option award agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, the Compensation Committee adopted an Executive Severance Plan (the &#x201C;Severance Plan&#x201D;) in February 2015, and the Company subsequently entered into Severance Plan Participation Agreements with its executive officers and certain key employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to providing participants with severance payments, the Severance Plan provides for accelerated vesting and extends the exercise period for outstanding equity awards if the Company terminates a participant&#x2019;s service for reasons other than cause, death or disability or the participant terminates his or her service for good reason, whether before or after a change of control (each of such terms as defined in the Severance Plan).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	To calculate option-based compensation, the Company uses the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. The Company&#x2019;s determination of fair value of option-based awards on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes model is affected by assumptions regarding a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	number of subjective variables.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The fair value of restricted stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, restricted stock units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and performance units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	measured based upon the quoted closing market price for the stock on the date of grant. The compensation cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the restricted stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and restricted stock units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is recognized on a straight-line basis over the vesting period.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;The compensation cost for the performance units is recognized when the performance criteria are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expected to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	complete.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tax benefits were attributed to the share-based compensation expense because the Company maintained a full valuation allowance for all net d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany follows the liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this method, taxes consist of taxes currently payable plus those deferred due to temporary differences between the financial statement carrying amounts and the tax bases of certain assets and liabilities using tax rates expected to be in effect when the temporary differences reverse. A valuation allowance is provided when it is more likely than not that some portion or the entire deferred tax asset will not be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany recognizes the effect of tax positions only when they are more likely than not to be sustained. Management has determined that the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany had no uncertain tax positions that would require financial statement recognition or disclosure. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany is no longer subject to U.S. federal, state or local income tax examinations for periods prior to 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Net Loss Per Share of Common Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Basic net loss per common share is calculated by dividing the net loss attributable to common stockholders by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period, without consideration for potentially dilutive securities. For purposes of the diluted net loss per share calculation, preferred stock, convertible notes payable-affiliated entities, stock options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, restricted stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and warrants are considered to be potentially dilutive securities. Because the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany has reported a net loss for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015 and 2014, diluted net loss per common share is the same as basic net loss per common share for those periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Common stock equivalents resulting from potentially dilutive securities approximated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	130
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,630
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively, and have not been included in the dilutive weighted average shares of common stock outstanding, as their effects are anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No. 2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, ("ASU 2014-09") which supersedes current revenue recognition guidance, including most industry-specific guidance. ASU 2014-09 requires a company to recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the company expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods and services, and also requires additional disclosures regarding the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue that is recognized. The guidance, as stated in ASU 2014-09, is effective for annual and interim periods beginning after December 15, 2016. In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-14, "Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606): Deferral of the Effective Date," which defers the effective date by one year, with early adoption on the original effective date permitted. The Company is evaluating the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	potential
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	impact the new guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In August 2014, FASB issued ASU 2014-15,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;This ASU requires management to assess an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern by incorporating and expanding upon certain principles that are currently in the U.S. auditing standards.&nbsp;&nbsp;Specifically, the ASU (1) provides a definition of the term substantial doubt, (2) requires an evaluation every reporting period including interim periods, (3) provides principles for considering the mitigating effect of management&#x2019;s plans, (4) requires certain disclosures when substantial doubt is alleviated as a result of consideration of management&#x2019;s plan, (5) requires an express statement and other disclosures when substantial doubt is not alleviated, and (6) requires an assessment for a period of one year after the date that the financial statements are issued (or available to be issued).&nbsp;&nbsp;This standard is effective for the fiscal years ending after December 15, 2016, and for annual periods and interim periods thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early application is permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is currently evaluating the new guidance to determine the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	potential
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	impact it will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In April 2015, FASB issued ASU No. 2015-03,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Simplifying the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which changes the presentation of debt issuance costs in the financial statements. ASU 2015-03 requires an entity to present such costs in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the related debt liability rather than as an asset. Amortization of the costs will continue to be reported as interest expense. The guidance is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, with early adoption permitted. The guidance will be applied retrospectively to each period presented. The adoption of this standard update is not expected to have any impact on the Company&#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In July 2015, FASB issued ASU 2015-11,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Inventory: Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which changes the measurement principle for inventory from the lower of cost or market to lower of cost and net realizable value. The ASU also eliminates the requirement for these entities to consider replacement cost or net realizable value less an approximately normal profit margin when measuring inventory. This guidance is effective for fiscal years and interim periods beginning after December 15, 2016. The Company does not expect the adoption of this guidance to have a material effect on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In September 2015, FASB issued ASU 2015-16,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Combinations (Topic 805): Simplifying the Accounting for Measurement-Period Adjustments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which requires that an acquirer recognize adjustments to provisional amounts that are identified during the measurement period in the reporting period in which the adjustment amounts are determined, including the cumulative effect of the change in provisional amount as if the accounting had been completed at the acquisition date. The adjustments related to previous reporting periods since the acquisition date must be disclosed by income statement line item either on the face of the income statement or in the notes. The guidance is effective for fiscal years and interim reporting periods within those years beginning after December 15, 2015, with early application permitted for financial statements that have not been issued. The amendments are to be applied prospectively to adjustments that occur after the effective date. The amendments will be effective for the Company for the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2016 and will be applied, as necessary, to future business combinations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes: Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	This update, which simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes, requires that deferred tax liabilities and assets be classified as non-current in a classified statement of financial position.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The guidance is effective for financial statements issued for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2017, and interim periods within annual periods beginning after December 15, 2018. Earlier adoption is permitted for all entities as of the beginning of an interim or annual reporting period.&nbsp; This amendment may be applied either prospectively or retrospective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	ly to all periods presented.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;The Company decided to early adopt this ASU
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	on a prospective basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	with no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	impact
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In January 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-01,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Financial Instruments - Recognition and Measurement of Financial Instruments and Financial Liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. This update requires that equity investments (except those accounted for under the equity method of accounting or those that result in consolidation) be measured at fair value with changes in fair value recognized in net income. The amendments in this update also simplify the impairment assessment of equity investments without readily determinable fair values. This update is effective for our fiscal y
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	ear beginning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	April
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	1, 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Page F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<A NAME="eolPage85"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#PDVW-20160331X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The ASU amends a number of aspects of lease accounting, including requiring lessees to recognize operating leases with a term greater than one year on their balance sheet as a right-of-use asset and corresponding lease liability, measured at the present value of the lease pa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	yments. The ASU also requires disclosure of key information about leasing arrangements to increase the transparency and comparability among organizations. The accounting for lessors does not fundamentally change except for changes to conform and align guidance to the lessee guidance as well as to the new revenue recognition guidance in ASU 2014-09.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendments in this ASU are effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018, including interim periods within those fiscal years.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Early adoption is permitted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Compensation - Stock Compensation, Improvements to Employee Share-Based payment Accounting (Topic 718)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. This update is intended to provide simplification of the accounting for share based payment transactions, including the accounting for income taxes, forfeitures, and statutory tax withholding requirements, as well as classification in the statement of cash flows. This update is effective for our fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year beginning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMESNEWROMANPSMT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	n April 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-10,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers: Identifying Performance Obligations and Licensing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. ASU 2016-10 is intended to reduce the cost and complexity of applying the guidance in the FASB's new revenue standard on identifying performance obligations, and is also intended to improve the operability and understandability of the licensing implementation guidance. The effective date for ASU 2016-10 is the same as for ASU 2014-09
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is evaluating the impact of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the new guidance will have on its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	onsolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inancial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tatements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Subsequent Events Evaluation by Management
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management has evaluated subsequent events for disclosure and/or recognition in the financial statements through the date that the financial statements were issued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventory consist
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the following at March 31, 2016 and March 31, 2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.26%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:12.10%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.64%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;

	and 201

	,

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	Wireless licenses are considered indefinite-lived intangible assets. Indefinite-lived intangible assets are not subject to amortization but instead are tested for impairment annually, or more frequently if an event indicates that the asset might be impaired. The Company believes that no impairment indicators existed as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	March
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	for which the Company w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	ould re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	cognize any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	impairment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	March 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	, the Company entered into agreements with several third parties in multiple U.S. markets to acquire wireless licenses for cash consideration, as well as a promissory note (see Note
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	), upon FCC approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also during the period, the Company entered into an agreement with a third party to exchange wireless licenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;Both exchanges occurred within the year ended March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&#xFEFF;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

	&#xFEFF;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.92%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">

	7

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Accounts Payable-officers
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounts payable-officers represents unreimbursed expenses including travel and entertainment expense incurred by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ompany&#x2019;s officers. At March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the accounts payable to officers amounted to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4,159
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	40,668
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	respectively.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	8.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the fiscal years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended March 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he Company had a non-qualified deferred compensation plan created by the management to defer part of their compensation. In September 2014, the Company paid the balance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$367,695
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the plan was discontinued.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
